Welcome
Hi, I’m Sanjay, and I’m not an expert on connectivity, but I’ve learned by tinkering, trial and error, and researching online with others.
What is managing a Jangala Big Box?
In this solution, you will be able to contact a charity in England that offers a very powerful portable modem that allows up to 100 people to connect to the internet at once, called the Big Box.
The organization that offers it is called Jangala and is dedicated to providing internet access to people in need of urgent humanitarian aid or longer-term development assistance.
NOTE! Jangala defines criteria for who can receive and benefit from its equipment or support.
It is important for you to know that these are not for personal use and that you must meet certain eligibility criteria. Based on the information you provide in the application form, they will assess whether your community or project can access their product.
We encourage you, together with your community, to invent a way in which internet connection could improve their living conditions and how they can use it for the common good. Develop your idea and tell Jangala about it. We are sure they will consider it.
What’s it for?
Imagine a community without connectivity. Without the technical knowledge to install, configure, and maintain a wireless network. Now imagine that, from one moment to the next, everyone can connect to a single Wi-Fi network.
What would happen? Among many things, an entire community could pay for a single internet plan and everyone could connect. Even better, they could connect from shared devices, such as computers or tablets, and enjoy faster speeds, a fun, and collaborative learning experience. That’s what they could achieve if they managed this device: the Big Box or Jangala.
Jangala’s Big Box is a lightweight device, the size of a briefcase, that transforms any form of internet connectivity into Wi-Fi that’s easy to manage and scale, from tens to thousands of users. It’s as if someone had a booster for a phone’s internet connection, working for hundreds, or even thousands, of computers.
Internet access is desperately needed in many situations around the world: from people trying to establish contact after an earthquake to educational projects in remote areas. However, in these situations, the Internet is often unavailable: networks frequently go down in emergency situations, and deploying effective Internet access in remote areas is complicated, slow, and expensive.
Who is Jangala? Jangala is an NGO in the United Kingdom that seeks to solve this problem with its devices.
This solution will help you learn how to manage this powerful modem with the Jangala organization and receive support to adapt the Big Box to the needs of your context or, if you are part of an organization, to the conditions of the communities they work with.
If you are from a low-income community or in remote areas, you may be considered to receive one of their devices free of charge and for life.
What do you need?

An internet connection and a computer (you can also use a cell phone)
Understanding English or translating with the online translator DeepL
Confidence in your management skills
Digital exclusion conditions. Jangala will estimate the likelihood of receiving a Big Box
Enthusiasm!

How to do it?


Moment 1: Go to www.janga.la and look for the Big Box request form
Go to www.janga.la to the “Request a Box” section. There you can decide if you need a Get Box, which is smaller, or a Big Box.
The next steps concern requesting a Big Box



Moment 2: Complete the online form
In the Big Box section, you will find a button that says Apply for a Big Box.
You must answer the questions on the form; this will help Jangala configure a Big Box that best meets your community’s needs.
The questionnaire is divided into four sections:

Section 1 asks questions about you and/or your organization.
Section 2 addresses the location for which you need a Big Box, including location, existing connectivity, and power supply.
Section 3 addresses Wi-Fi setup.
Section 4 contains final questions about how the Big Box will make a difference.

If anything on this form is unclear or doesn’t apply to your community’s situation, please feel free to email info@janga.la.
Filling out this form may take some time, and you may not have all the answers clear. Please try to answer as many questions as possible and don’t forget to submit.


Moment 3: Wait for a response and establish a relationship with Jangala.
It may take a couple of weeks to receive a response via email from the Jangala team. They will contact you using the email address you registered on the form.
Please be patient and listen for a response… this will be a very exciting moment!
There may be additional questions or a virtual meeting with you may be required. During the meeting, you can clarify any additional concerns, discuss the specifics of your Big Box, and the process for receiving it by mail.
The Jangala team is exceptional: very friendly and genuinely willing to help.


Moment 4: Plan and receive the Big Box by mail
After clarifying how Jangala will ship the device, it won’t take more than a couple of weeks to receive the Big Box with the features you need.
It’s very important to ask the Jangala team to clearly state on the certified mail delivery that it’s a goods with no commercial value. Depending on the country you’re in, customs may require specific information about the device in order to receive the package.
For example, in Colombia, it’s necessary to include the IMEI number, which is used to register a cell phone, on the shipping invoice for a cell phone if it’s included in the package you’re sending. If this isn’t done, the package must be nationalized at customs, which is a complex and expensive process. Either way, the Jangala team will be of great support in resolving any challenges, and they will cover those costs.


Moment 5: Install the Big Box with the support of the Jangala team
Finally, all that’s left is to install the Big Box in the location where it will be used, and that’s it!
The Jangala team will offer support to guide you through plugging and using it. For example, you can do so through WhatsApp to offer almost immediate support. Once installed, you’ll have Wi-Fi for 100 people within a 100-meter radius!
Now all that’s left is to use it for the common good.


How do I know if this solution works?
Each Box provides Wi-Fi over any form of internet signal (3G/4G, landline, satellite), can use power from a variety of sources (mains, battery, cigarette lighter, renewable source, generator), and can use an external antenna to pick up 3G/4G signals where phones can’t. You’ll find more features below.
If you’re a charity or group in need of connectivity, Jangala would love to hear from you. For organizations with limited financial means providing vital basic services to those affected by disasters or those in need of long-term development assistance, Jangala can provide systems as long-term, cost-free loans.

How many people does it connect? 100 alone. With additional equipment, 1,000. With extensive equipment, up to 5,000.
Can it be used in a mobile environment? Yes.
Can it be used outdoors? Yes. It’s waterproof and durable.
Can it power additional Wi-Fi hotspots? Yes. They can be used to connect up to 5,000 people over a wide area.
How many networks can it broadcast? Four. Each can be customized for content control, speed restrictions, and data restrictions.

Why might this solution work?
The Jangala Big Box won’t solve connectivity issues if there’s no internet signal (wired, mobile, or satellite) in your area. But it does offer an opportunity to provide free or very low-cost connectivity for an entire community. For example, a school or a refugee camp. Imagine the learning opportunities if they use the internet together!

Form is important
Welcome
Hi! I’m Manu and I’m not a professional designer, but that’s what tinkering is all about, learning on your own.
I love to design, draw and create. Collage making is one of my favorite hobbies.
What is it like to design an invitation, without being an expert?
I’m excited to teach you how to design an amazing invitation for your next SOLE or activity. At SOLE Colombia we have learned how to use Canva, but you can design your invitation however you like, even by hand! you can do it!
What is it for?
Many times we feel that we are not going to be able to make an invitation as beautiful as the ones made by others. Sometimes we don’t have much manual skill, or we think that our creative ability is not enough.
But now you can change the chip and discover how to make a beautiful invitation! Whether by hand, or using technical resources, you can use different techniques that, for sure, will surprise you.
What do you need?

A computer, tablet or phone with Internet access (if you are going to use Canva).
Colored paper, colored pencils, markers and pens (if you are going to do it by hand).
Creativity.

How to do it?
Let’s start with the analog - your invitation by hand or with traditional technique.

Color, make it look pretty

Use colored paper or whatever you have on hand and start bringing your invitation to life using colored pencils, markers or pens.
Add creative details such as decorative borders, simple illustrations or symbols that represent the essence of your event. You can also think of colored boxes to highlight information that you think is valuable.
Play with different colors and shading techniques to make your design visually appealing and unique.


The text, say what you need to say

Write the details of the event in a way that is easy to read. You can use your own handwriting or cut and paste printed letters such as those from newspapers, magazines, posters… you can even make some with play dough or other materials you have on hand!
Use the resources in the previous section to highlight essential information.
Be creative with the text and make sure it is clear to your guests. You can ask someone close to you for an opinion, as several pairs of eyes are always better than one.
Be careful not to overload it, otherwise people may get lost among so much information… remember, ‘less is more’.


Review, it’s important

Review your design and add the final touches to perfect it, ask for feedback, and you are sure to get help from your trusted people.
Don’t forget to check the spelling of words very carefully. A well-written message is well understood and does not give rise to confusion, remember that your goal is that people understand everything well and can attend what you are inviting them to.
If you want to make your invitation reach further, you can spread it digitally: scan your creation or simply take a high quality photo to distribute it by electronic messaging (mail, whatsapp, telegram…) or social networks.



Go digital - venture out and try the technology available.


Log in to Canva
Let’s get started! Open your browser and visit canva.com. If you don’t have an account yet, you can create one for free.
  


Select a size
Once inside Canva, choose the ideal size for your invitation. You can opt for a standard postcard size or customize the dimensions to suit your needs.
Choose a Template or Start From Scratch Would you prefer to start with a pre-designed template or let your creativity run wild from scratch? Here you can explore the options and find the style you like best:
  


Customize your Design
Change the background and add elements such as text, images and decorations that represent the theme of your event. Experiment with different color combinations, fonts and styles to make your invitation unique and exciting - don’t be afraid to try new ideas and tweak details until your design shines!
See how mine turned out:
  


Download your Invitation
When you’re happy with your design, click the download button and choose your desired format (JPEG or PNG) - your invitation is ready to print or share online!
  


How do I know if this solution works?
You need to check if your invitation content and design work. The easiest thing to do is to get an outside opinion to make sure everything is in order and that you can send it out as soon as possible.
Why might this solution work?
There are some key considerations when evaluating the design of your invitation, here are some questions that can guide your thinking:

whether the information is clear enough (time, place…) and whether it is easy to find and understand, check the text, font and text/image configuration so that it is not too cluttered
whether it is visually appealing, consistent with the theme of the event, captures attention and generates interest
whether the style is aligned with the formality of the event and is appropriate for the target audience
if it is easy to share, visualize, understand the steps to be taken or the call to action you are proposing.

All of these aspects work for you for your invitations, but you can also help others do theirs… and, even if you’re not an expert now, you will be very soon!
Recommended solutions

How to write a good invitation | How to write a good invitation
Descubre a tu audiencia | Discover your audience
Difunde tu mensaje  | Spread your message 
Crea un mensaje potente | Create a powerful message

Now you have all the tools and inspiration you need to create a memorable and personalized invitation!
Remember, you can do it! Let your creativity run wild and make your next event a success with this guide - have fun designing!

Welcome
Hi, I’m Sanjay and one of my big ventures is to make community use of the resources we have available. I like to tinker, yes, but I’m also interested in the ways we humans coordinate to live better together.
What is taking up a collection to pay for community internet?
This solution gathers ideas on how to collect money to pay for a community connection, that is, to get a community to agree to financially support an asset that will be given common use and enjoyment.
What is it for?
Finding ways to organize ourselves to acquire the things that improve our living conditions is sometimes a complex task.
If you know that you need Internet, but you don’t know how to get the people in your community to follow your idea, to support you in the maintenance and sustainability of the contract, or you don’t know what steps to follow to be able to do it together, in this solution you can find useful orientations.
What do you need?

A very clear idea of what you want to collect the money for.
Charisma, words and people skills to convince people to participate in the collection.
Order to keep the accounts, handle the money and inform the people who collaborate with you of the course of the collection and the status of the accounts.
Communication skills to inform the collaborators of the status of the service, maintenance needs or incidents. Also to receive suggestions or process the formalities required for the formalization or maintenance of the service.

How to do it?
These recommendations are relevant when collecting money for community purposes. They are not necessarily followed in order, nor are they the only ones, but we believe they can help you.


Moment 1: Let’s put together a team, it’s easier to do it together.
Look for partners to start this campaign.
When we undertake projects for a common good, it is easy to get allies to distribute responsibilities. When you do this type of initiative alone, you can quickly get tired and give up, but with others this project will be more bearable.
Define who will be in charge of what, this will make the work more organized and you will be able to follow up more easily.


Moment 2: Give a purpose to the collection that is clear and that excites you.
It is important to have the time to reflect and project what we want to do, what is it that we want to achieve? Remember, money is only a means to reach something bigger and more important… that is called purpose.
In this case, what is it that unites us in this collection, that inspires us to move to raise the funds? When you are establishing the purpose of a project it is time to tirelessly ask ourselves what for, until we are convinced.
Doing SOLE is a great way to find a purpose for the fundraiser, besides paying for it together, you can learn, dialogue and create thriving communities, using the internet as a group. Paying for the internet together allows you to use it to do SOLE, or for anything you can think of!
For example:

Why do we want internet in a public access place? So that people in my community can learn new things they need or want to learn, talk and dialogue with other people and communities in a Big Conversation, and take action in a self-organized way to live better together.
Why do we want people in our community to be able to learn together? So that it is not necessary to depend exclusively on learning spaces and people related to the educational system, to realize that anyone can learn anything, using the internet. Why in a group? Because going anywhere alone is a difficult path, on the other hand, when we do it together, it is better.
What do we want them to be able to converse through the internet for? Interacting with other people with the objective of learning or that others can be part of our life always makes us feel better. Learning together when there are other people who participate in our findings and with whom we can walk the path together, makes us feel that what we learn transcends and is bigger than us. If people connect with each other through the internet it is because we are mutually interested in each other and can accompany each other, we are not alone on the road… Want to connect with people around the world in your SOLE sessions? Check out the SOLE Granny Cloud! They are volunteers from all over the world, who connect to SOLE sessions to accompany, provide warm encouragement, share, learn and have fun together.
Why do we want to help our community to flourish, so that we can all have a happier, fuller and tastier life!

Does it make sense to have public access internet in our community? Of course!


Moment 3: Let’s identify those who might be interested in participating.
Who among our neighbors would be interested in having community internet? What interest might they have in contributing monetarily to this project? Then we can translate our project to their possible interests.
Here are some examples of SOLEros who have self-organized to learn together, using the internet:

Elainer, when he used SOLE for young people in his community to learn how to make video games.
Robinson, who used SOLE so that his community could find sustainable alternatives to traditional crops in his community.
Maria, when, through SOLE, she got her students to take responsibility for their own educational process and changed the way they researched and learned in her school.



Moment 4: A story, the best way to communicate an idea
Now that we know who we are going to target with our campaign, let’s create a story. We recommend answering five fundamental questions: who, what, when, where and why.
Here is ours:
In the community of La Piche, a delicious honey is grown. Everyone in the community works in trades related to the production of its delicious honey: some have honeycombs, others collect the honey, others sell it, some manufacture related products…
We are a group of young people interested in creating natural cosmetic products based on honey and beeswax, but we do not know how to start manufacturing these products, nor the tools we need, nor the permits we require or how we could market them, etc. We want to start with how can we make a honey and beeswax lipstick?
Using the Internet we could find answers to these and other Big Questions!
The cheapest Internet plan is 120,000 COP, no one on the sidewalk could afford it. But we have thought that, making a group of 12 people or families, we could pay a monthly fee of 10,000 COP and put the broadband internet by fiber optics in a place of easy access for everyone, such as the nursing home, the community hall or Doña Adela’s store, which is the business that is open most of the time and where we could all connect. The connection could be used by all of us, even the children on the sidewalk, to do their homework.
So, if you are interested and can be part of this collection, join this list! We will soon be able to have internet for us!
All expenses and bill payments will be sent on the first of each month to a WhatsApp group and we will be able to keep up to date with any new developments.
Will you join the cause?


Moment 5: Buy, communicate and organize the expenses
With the money collected you just have to make the purchase.
Remember that none of these contracts have permanence clauses, so if you are not satisfied with the service, you can cancel it and move to another operator.
It is important to be organized with your accounts and communicate payments and any new developments or inconveniences immediately to everyone involved.
In this way, everyone can take co-responsibility for any decisions regarding this collection and can assume the responsibilities or consequences together.
Be sure to create a flow of communication with your collaborators, so that you can communicate in both directions and quickly solve any problems that may arise.


How do you know if this solution works?
With this solution, you manage to organize the neighbors towards a common good, embodied in the payment of a service, to take advantage of it collectively and make the best possible use of it.
It also improves the connectivity conditions of the place where we live, making it a better place to live.
Why might this solution work?
Organizing ourselves to achieve things will get us as far as we want to go.
In this case, it allows us to have a shared internet and a public access point. It is important to measure very well the bandwidth offered by the service to hire. Thus, we will be able to hire a sufficiently fast and powerful service in relation to the number of people we want to link to that connection.
The next step would be how to improve the conditions of this connectivity, without a significant increase in costs.

en/solve/raspberry-pi-a-small-pocket-siz.content:
Raspberry Pi: A small pocket-sized Internet
Created: 29 de julio de 2025 17:02
Autor: Gabriel
Solucionas: Devices
Dificultad: Difícil
Cuesta: >$200 COP
Ayudantes: 2-3 personas
Tardas: Horas

index
Install a web server on a pocket computer
Welcome
Hi, I’m Gabriel. I’m an artist. Digital devices, how they work and the way we humans interact with them, are interesting to me. I consider myself a gadgeteer and I invite you, if you want, to be one too.
What is a RaspberryPi, or a pocket Internet?
This solution will help you to create a small internet on your local network with few resources.
By installing and configuring a server on the network, your community will be able to access the content hosted on it from their computers or phones. This way they will be able to have, for example, a copy of wikipedia so that everyone can review it whenever they need it, without the need to access the Internet to do so.
What is it for?
If we are talking about using the Internet to solve Big Questions and real-life challenges in a group, having content accessible offline may be an excellent option: for example, if you are going to do SOLE in a very remote location, where you know that connectivity is definitely not going to be feasible.
Having downloadable content offline will allow them to do some research and come to some conclusions, which they can expand on at another time with Internet connectivity or when they can plug in a Granny.
Want to know more about how to turn your space into a place to learn, or who the Abuelitas of the Cloud are? Visit www.solecolombia.org/solea to learn how and browse the site to learn more about the Abuelitas Cloud that can support the learning processes happening in your space.
How do you know if you need it?
Ask yourself how good your Internet connection is where you are going to connect from. In SOLE Colombia we know the difficulties of many remote communities, where the Internet is scarce or difficult to access, and a solution like this allows people to access downloaded content, which is almost like having access to their twins on the network.
Thus, it becomes possible to navigate in a replica of some parts of the Internet, learning to use the technology in a different way.
Even if its features are many and obvious, this is a solution that requires a powerful gadget spirit and high doses of commitment and patience… we are sure that you can manage to set up your own little pocket internet!
What do you need?

Raspberry Pi
MicroSD card 32 GB class 10
Power supply for the Raspberry Pi - check the specifications on Raspberry Pi
Ethernet cable
MicroSD to USB memory adapter.
RPI box (optional)
Internet connection
A computer
Patience

How to do it?


Step 1: Prepare your Pi
For this solution we are using a Raspberry Pi v4, but previous versions can be used without problem.
If you are starting with a new Raspberry Pi and you have a plastic case, assemble the heatsink on the RPI processor and place it inside its protective case before proceeding.
The Raspberry Pi developers have created a tool to make it easy to download, install and configure the MicroSD memory sticks that will have the operating system running the RPI.


Install the software specific to your operating system, Raspberry Pi Imager.
To install it on your computer visit www.raspberrypi.com/software/. There you can download the version of the Raspberry Pi Imager that works on your operating system (Windows, Linux or Mac) once installed you can proceed to the next step.
  


Connect the MicroSD to your computer
Before running the Raspberry Pi Imager, you must connect the MicroSD memory to your computer.
To do this you need to use a USB adapter if your computer does not have a slot for it.
Once you verify that the memory is in the computer run the Raspberry Pi Imager and continue with the solution.


Open the Raspberry Pi Imager and choose your operating system.
  




Moment 2: Connect your Pi


Place it on the Pi Imager
Now that our Pi is connected to the power, and to our **local network,** we must locate it to be able to connect to it.
Before this, a small note: the following steps will be done through a Terminal. If you are using a Unix-like [operating system](../../Conceptorio 12a2bd68c5b6808baf3be5e67cddb488/Conceptorio 1624106bff984c4590342afeae3e5e0d/Sistema operativo (SO)%20Operating%20system%20(OS)%202342bd68c5b68003b66beb552afaa17a.md) (Linux, MacOs), simply look for the terminal and there you can follow the steps (see below how to do it). If you are using Windows, you can use CMD in this step and, to connect to the Pi, you can use Putty.
To locate the Pi in a Terminal we use the ping program, it will try to send a small packet of data to the address that we indicate and it will tell us among other things the IP address of the computer.
Here we are going to make use of the name we gave to our Pi, in our case solevoltage. In the terminal we type ping solevoltaje.local and the program will answer us with the IP 192.168.0.25, which indicates that our Pi is available for us to connect and start working.
  


Connect to the Pi
So that the connection between your Pi and the rest of devices is secure, we connect by means of a SSH Protocol to our Pi. To do this, we type in our terminal ssh solevoltaje@solevoltaje.local or with the IP Address ssh solevoltaje@192.168.0.25
Remember that we must put our username and domain name or IP in the parameters we give to SSH ssh <username>@<domain name>.
As soon as the connection is established, the system will ask for the password. Type the same one you entered in the configuration in the previous steps and finish by pressing the enter key.


Update the software

Once we are connected to the Pi we must do a couple of administration tasks. The first is to update our operating system software. We do this by typing the following in the terminal:
sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade

Once the task of downloading and configuring the new software is finished we can continue with the solution.

The commands that we enter in this line start with sudo to have superuser premises and to be able to apply changes to the system.



Expand the SWAP

Now, it is necessary to expand the SWAP Memory space so that our Pi can easily deal with operations that require more memory than we have available in RAM. Perform the following steps one after the other:
First we disable SWAP memory.
sudo dphys-swapfile swapoff

Then we edit the configuration file and change the size to our needs:
sudo nano /etc/dphys-swapfile

In the file look for the line that by default says CONF_SWAPSIZE=100 and change it to CONF_SWAPSIZE=2048. Then save and exit the text editor.
Now we need to activate the new configuration:
sudo dphys-swapfile setup

We activate the SWAP memory again :
sudo dphys-swapfile swapon

Finally, we reboot the Pi so that all programs have access to the new SWAP:
sudo reboot

This last command, reboots the Pi, closing our remote connection. You must wait for the process to complete in a couple of minutes and reconnect via SSH Protocol to continue.


Now, we install the server

After all this preparatory process, which is simpler than it seems we proceed to install nginx, a program that will allow our Pi can function as a web server and thus we can access from other devices through a web browser to resources that we have hosted there.
Once we are connected to the Pi we write in the terminal:
sudo apt install nginx

This line downloads, installs and starts our server.




Moment 3: Test that everything works fine

Now, we test that everything is working.
For it, in our computer, we open a window of a web browser and in the address bar we write solevoltaje.local.
If everything is working correctly, we should see a page like the one in the image that says Welcome to nginx.


How to know if this solution works?
With this solution, you will have a local server that allows you to host content that will be visible on the local network.
In this way, you can download useful material for the SOLE sessions and not need Internet access to answer the Big Questions. You can also think about uploading content that you would like to take to a remote location or that you would like to share with others, e.g. movies, educational material, instructions, online games… or anything that you can download to use with others!
Because the Pi is so small you can take it to different places and have a pocket-sized Internet.
Why would this solution work?
With this solution you will have a portable server, however it still doesn’t have any information to share, we recommend you check out the other solutions we have in the guide to get the most out of your new server.

Public spaces are also yours
Welcome
Hi, I’m Manu. As a SOLE Explorer I have had to learn how to ask for community spaces in the places where we have gone to do SOLE and I know that it is not always easy to know where to start.
What is it like to ask for a community room, or any community space?
This is a solution that guides you on how you can reserve a communal space to use the Internet as a group, or for whatever it is you want to do in this space. Remember that each space has its own rules and application procedures, so this solution can guide you on the criteria, but it is not a definitive solution.
If you have any suggestions on how you do it in your community, that you think may help other people, I invite you to comment on the solution, the Internet is created by all of us!
What is it for?
In SOLE Colombia we believe that it is more fun when we do things together. Communal spaces are spaces for us to meet with others, to connect, to celebrate, to share, and you can use them too.
Here are some steps you can follow to reserve the communal room closest to you.
Good luck!
What do you need?

Good attitude, believe in yourself
Identity document to sign the reservation (OPTIONAL)
Letter to request the reservation of the space (OPTIONAL)

How to do it?


Moment 1: Discover the place and go to it.
Once you have decided where you want to hold your activity, go to the community hall and talk to the people in charge.
Introduce yourself to them and tell them why you want to use the space, what you want to use it for, and how many people have confirmed.
Also encourage them to participate in your activity, for example, if you are going to do a SOLE, you can invite them to become participants.
  


Moment 2: Ask about the requirements, what you need to formalize the application.
  
Once you are in contact with the people in charge, ask them about the availability of the place and what requirements you need, or how you can book it.


Step 3: Make the reservation letter or meet the requirements of the venue
Usually, community halls require a letter to reserve the venue.
Write down what the activity will consist of, when it will take place and who the organizers and participants will be.
It is also very important that you include your contact details, they will need them to confirm if it is possible for your activity to take place at the time you have planned.
We also advise you to include a few words of thanks for the authorization to use the space.
You may need to attach a photocopy of your identity document, so be prepared for this.
Do you think an example could help you? Here are the steps we have to take into account and how the example would look like:

Include place and date where you are.
Head the letter with the name or denomination of the person or entity that owns or manages the space.
Introduce yourself as the person responsible for the application or organization of the activity.
Explain the purpose of the activity and the details of the activity. You can also request elements that you need to carry out your activity, for example, chairs, tables, computers or other elements that you require and that are within the reach of whoever is lending you the room.
Thank them for their attention and let them know how they can give you an answer. It may be your phone number or a way to contact you.
Finally, sign the letter.

This is what this written form would look like:


💡 Vereda El Montecillo Municipality of Arracachal
February 13, 2038

Good morning,

My name is (your full name), I am identified with CC No. (Cédula Number), and I am contacting you to request the use of the (name of the space or meeting room) to carry out an activity, in the company of people from the community.

My idea is to use the space to learn, dialogue and solve some challenges of my community that we will identify in the meeting, using the Internet as a group.

The details of the meeting are: - Date: on (day of the week), (day) of (month) of (year) - Time: at (time) - Number of people: we will meet (number) people - Duration of the meeting: (time)

To carry out the activity, we need some conditions and furniture: one chair per person, some tables where we can place some computers and the possibility to plug them in (so they don't run out of battery). It is also necessary to have electricity and Internet connection available. 

We commit ourselves to take care of the common space and to comply with the rules of use in this space of all.

You can contact me at (phone number) or through (other means of contact).

Thank you very much for your attention, I look forward to hearing from you

(Name of the person who signs).


<img src="/assets\images\A pocket Wikipedia in your RaspberryPi 1a42bd68c5b680289571fc002238a69a\image 2-800w.webp" alt="image.png" srcset="/assets\images\A pocket Wikipedia in your RaspberryPi 1a42bd68c5b680289571fc002238a69a\image 2-400w.webp 400w, /assets\images\A pocket Wikipedia in your RaspberryPi 1a42bd68c5b680289571fc002238a69a\image 2-800w.webp 800w, /assets\images\A pocket Wikipedia in your RaspberryPi 1a42bd68c5b680289571fc002238a69a\image 2-1200w.webp 1200w" sizes="(max-width: 600px) 400px, (max-width: 1200px) 800px, 1200px" loading="lazy" />

*Remember that this is only an example, you can elaborate the letter as you wish. Don't forget to ask the person in charge what information, data or attachments you should include in the document.*



Step 4: Request a follow-up contact and ask for confirmation, don’t wait too long.
It may happen that your confirmation needs to pass some filters or that the process takes some time. Although you should not lose your composure, it is a good idea to ask for the contact person’s information to follow up on the process, so you can make sure that you can plan and carry out your activity within the deadlines you had planned.


Moment 5: Thank the management and celebrate, you have found an ally in your community!
Once you have received confirmation that you can use the space, don’t forget to thank the person in charge with whom you had contact from the beginning.
You can write her an email, a WhatsApp message or greet her in the street reminding her how important her support was to get the activity carried out. It’s a good ally for future occasions when you want to use the community room again.


Let us know how you did booking the community hall in your sidewalk, community or complex! :)
How do you know if this solution works?
Once you have your space reserved, it’s just a matter of iterating the process as many times as you need to. You may be able to make a larger request that lasts longer. To do this, it may be useful to draw on the good news, findings and successes of the activity you have proposed in the space and how it is bearing fruit in the community.
For example, when you get a group of people to do SOLE on a recurring basis, you can see the benefits it has for skills such as communication, negotiation, reading comprehension, digital skills, autonomy, leadership… making a small report, for example, with the result of the Reflection capsules (available on the SOLE Colombia website n9.cl/reflexionatusole, can be very powerful to strengthen the relationship with your ally and with the people in your community.
Why might this solution work?
Sometimes, procedures involving large entities, or involving the decision of many people, can take time. It is important that, at the time of the application, you are clear about the deadlines and can set reminders to follow up on your request.
Often it is enough to remember the person with whom you made the request, stop by to say hello politely and remind them that you are waiting for a response. He/she will thank you for your attention and will surely put more love in order to have an answer to give you.

Find the available networks around you
Welcome
Hi, I’m Belen and I welcome you. I didn’t write this solution, but I’m going to walk you through it and I’d love that, at the end, you can tell me if you liked it, if you found it useful and if you can apply it in your context.
What is searching for WiFi signals around you with a mobile app?
Searching for WiFi signals with a mobile app involves using software on your smartphone to scan, analyze and find available wireless networks where you are. Many times, you will think that you have no Internet or that your mobile signal is poor (it depends on the service provided by your operator where you are), but, if you look closely, there may be some WiFi network with better connection or even free.
What is it for?
Sometimes, the place where we are may not have Internet access, but if we move and go to a nearby place, we may find WiFi networks. Sometimes, even if we find them, we will not be able to access them because we do not know their respective keys.
The WiFi Map application shows us a map with WiFi networks within a radius of 2 kilometers, according to the location of your device, and shares its access key. The networks saved in this application can be public or private.
If you want to make the most of a nearby connection, you can connect to those networks for group use using SOLE. You just need a few devices, four or five people eager to learn per device, and Great Questions to solve. Want to know more about how to do SOLE? See how to do it here: ¿Cómo hacer SOLE? - Tutorial
What do you need?

Cell phone
Available space on your cell phone
Mobile data connection
Generosity

How to do it?


Step 1: Install the app

Before starting the installation process, you need to have a stable Internet connection.
Once you have found it, you can open the “Google Play” application for Android or Apple Store for IOS and search for the WiFi Map application.
Alternatively, you can access one of these links through a web browser:

play.google.com/store/apps/details
apps.apple.com/us/app/wifi-map-free-wifi-near-you/id548925969





Step 2: Configure the app
Once the app is installed, open it and accept the terms of use. Among them, it is very important that you accept the access to your location while the app is in use.
  
Open the app and swipe down from the top of your phone to access the control panel. Activate the location, in case the app has not already done so.
  


Moment 3: Start using the app
When you are shown a map of the world, press the “arrowhead” icon and the map will be located in your region.
At the bottom of the screen, the nearest WiFi networks for which we have the access password will appear.
  
  
  


Step 4: Select a network

When you can see the list of WiFi networks ******networks that you have nearby, you can select one and see its access data.
Sometimes the application will ask you to watch a video, before allowing you to see the passwords of the networks. This is the way the app uses advertising to finance itself in its unpaid version.

  
  


How to know if this solution works?
With this recipe you can access multiple WiFi networks, both public and private. In cities, or urban centers, you will have a much better chance of finding networks with their access data available, compared to smaller population centers.
Now, with a Wifi network you can have more stability and speed to connect to the Internet, and why not to search for answers to your Big Questions, to learn, to take courses or to share the resource with others.
Are you ready to get started?
Why would this solution work?
This solution will allow you to have temporary access to the Internet, mainly from population centers where users like you have shared access data to a public or private Internet network.
In order to access these keys you must have internet access, since only the paid application allows you to download the map with the access information.

Reach the hearts of the people your message touches
Welcome
Good morning! This is Manu. Today I want to share with you some powerful techniques you can use to get your message to more people and generate a positive impact in your community.
What is spreading your message?
When it comes to spreading a message that really matters to us, we want to make sure that it reaches as many people as possible, and that those people respond to our call.
In this solution, I’ll share some strategies with you so you can test which medium is the best for getting your message across.
What is it good for?
Knowing how to best disseminate your message will allow you to reach your audience more efficiently. You will be able to reach a wider audience, more specialized in what you want to tell them, you will be able to inform, spread, infect… in the best possible way!
Whether others can appreciate the value and importance of what you say is related to the way you disseminate it, so, if you want to ‘reach better’ and make more strategic decisions, you need to
What do you need?

Colored paper and/or cardstock.
Colored pencils, markers and pens.
Computer or cell phone with Internet access to send messages via WhatsApp.
Comfortable shoes to personally connect with the community.
A good dose of enthusiasm and authenticity.

How to do it?


Moment 0: Define what you want to tell and what you want your audience to do.
To define your message in detail, you can review the solution Create a powerful message, where you can define exactly what you want to spread and what is the purpose of your communication.
Now, to know if your message is being powerful, you need to include in your message a key aspect: the call to action, or what is called in communication Call To Action. This refers to the action you are asking the person to take, once they have received your message, and which will confirm to you that this is indeed the case.
For example, a call to action might be “sign up for the list below”. As soon as you see a number of names written down, you will know that your message has been well received. In digital media, you can use reactions (emojis, comments) to find out if people are seeing your content, or design some other way to get people to interact with you and confirm that your message has reached them.


Moment 1: First of all, who is your target audience, who do you want to address?
You need to think about your audience before deciding on the channel you are going to use to deliver your message. You can adapt to different media, the important thing is that the message reaches the person you want to reach.
Keep in mind that, if you have partnered with a place that convenes (see the solution ¿Cómo aliarse con lugares que convocan?), it may be that your partner already knows very well the people it knows how to convene. If so, you can let your ally advise you and learn from their way of doing things!
If you already know who you want to invite or reach with your message, a good tactic is to use the media most used by those people.


💡  For example, if your target audience is young people between 18 and 25 years old interested in technology, platforms like WhatsApp and other Social Networks could be effective channels to reach them.
Activity: 

1. Describe on a sheet of paper your target audience and ask yourself: what do the people you want to reach do? how old are they? what do they like to do? 
2. Draw the media these people would normally use: do they use Social Networks? do they read newspapers? do they listen to community radio? 
3. Underline in the list which are the winning media.

[Ilustración_sin_título(11)(1).mp4](Difunde tu mensaje 12a2bd68c5b680588087f05f6f249a90/Ilustracion_sin_titulo(11)(1).mp4)

That's it! When you finish this exercise you will know that the media listed on the sheet are the ones you should focus on to deliver your message. 



Moment 2: Second, define the channel, how are you going to reach them?


The digital broadcast channels.
WhatsApp, Instagram, email, Facebook, Phone, it doesn’t matter which one. What matters is that they are accessible media for your audience, that is, the people you want to call, or to whom you want to reach.
In Colombia WhatsApp is widely used to send messages. I invite you to exploit all the resources it has: send voice notes, messages, photos, make a group, you can even create polls to decide what time is best for all your guests to participate.
Here is an example of what an invitation sent by WhatsApp could look like:
![WhatsApp Image 2024-04-11 at 4.23.41 PM.jpeg](Difunde tu mensaje 12a2bd68c5b680588087f05f6f249a90/WhatsApp_Image_2024-04-11_at_4.23.41_PM.jpeg)


Analogous dissemination channels
Create billboards and flyers
Stick billboards, flyers, flyers, that transmit your message in strategic places. Go to places where your community gathers such as local stores or community centers.
You can also knock on your neighbors’ doors and hand deliver the invitation.
Here are some posters we have put up in stores to invite the Boca de Camarones community to build The Library of the Future:
  
Get out on the street
Time to put on your comfiest shoes and go out and conquer the community!
Go to the places where the people of your community, or their leaders, gather… Give yourself the opportunity to jump right in and talk to strangers, it’s your time to shine!
When you approach people, tell them why your activity is so important.
Listen carefully and show genuine interest in what they say. Make authentic connections and make new friends while sharing your passion.
Every conversation is an opportunity to learn and make the impact of your activity greater!
[Vídeo sin título ‐ Hecho con Clipchamp (9).mp4](Difunde tu mensaje 12a2bd68c5b680588087f05f6f249a90/Vdeo_sin_ttulo__Hecho_con_Clipchamp_(9).mp4)




Moment 3: Reach out to others for help, there is strength in numbers.
By joining forces with others, we multiply our impact. Join with your peers, community leaders, friends and family who share your values and goals. Invite them to join in and tell them about your message so they can replicate it, ensuring that your activity is on everyone’s lips.
Seek support from organizations, community radio stations, local media, schools or community action boards committed to your cause or activity. Approach their spaces, share the importance of your activity and the details of your call, such as dates and times, clearly. They will surely be able to help you replicate the call.
Remember, word of mouth is key to expand your impact; work as a team and make your message reach more people!


Moment 4: Receive the responses and evaluate the success of your campaign.
Remember earlier we talked about the call to action? That is, are the people to whom you addressed your message doing what you asked them to do? Bravo! So, you did get your message out.
Evaluate the reception and impact of your message - everything counts! For example, the hearts given to your message on WhatsApp, the comments, or the messages you received by listening to the direct response of someone in your community.


How do you know this solution works?
It is important that you monitor the way your message reaches your audience. To know this, sometimes it is enough to ask how they felt about it, if it reached them clearly enough, if they felt that the way you executed the dissemination was relevant and sufficient.
There are some indicators with which you can evaluate the adequacy of a message’s dissemination:

whether you have been able to deliver it and someone has received it
whether any of the calls to action have had an effect
whether other people received the message, even if they were not the ones you initially addressed it to
if you received good feedback

Why might this solution work?
If you’re not getting the responses you expect, or something in the outreach doesn’t seem to be working well, it’s time to check.
Make sure your message has relevant content:

has relevant, targeted content for your audience (below are some important considerations)
is focused on a target audience
it is a quality written message, check grammar, spelling and syntax, and that it is easy to understand
the way you send it is aligned with your audience (time of day, day of the week, medium you are sending it through…)
it is important to be respectful, both with people’s data and with the way and the moment in which we communicate things, keep this in mind.

Communication is a living process, you can revise it as many times as you want and you will get better and better at it. The more you practice, the better and more easily you will be able to create powerful messages and spread them in a more efficient and powerful way.
Remember that together we can achieve great things!
Write to us at **@sole_colombia** and, if you need it, we can help you get more exposure on Social Networks.
Dare to share your initiatives and make your message reach everyone in the community!

Invest your money well to install Internet

Welcome
Hi, I’m Nicolas and, like you, I’ve been learning about how to improve my internet connection. I’m not an expert on the subject, but by searching, making tutorials and learning from trial and error I have worked on improving the quality of the internet in places that don’t have good connectivity.
In this particular solution we will understand what are the criteria to choose which satellite internet best fits our connectivity needs. We will also face some ethical issues that may condition our choice.
Our advice: decide with head and heart, the option that best serves your needs and those of your community.
What is choosing satellite Internet wisely?
Satellite Internet is a technology designed so that the Internet signal is sent through a satellite located in orbit to the satellite dish of your home or business.
With satellite internet you can connect computers, cell phones, tablets, etc. This technology does not require the wiring used, for example, by fiber optic internet.
What is it for?
This solution helps you to decide which satellite internet is the most convenient to buy if you are located in a place that does not have internet connection.
In this solution we will discuss the advantages and disadvantages of three different solutions so that you can make a conscious and responsible decision: satellite dish, WiMax or Starlink.
****Before we start, we suggest that, in case you decide to buy some of the options presented in this solution, you can pay for it together with other people and thus enjoy a communal use of the Internet.
¿Cómo saber si necesito esta solución?
Antes de empezar, nos gustaría hacerte algunas preguntas: ¿Actualmente cuentas con internet de fibra óptica o móvil de regular o buena calidad? En donde vives, ¿puedes ver torres de telecomunicaciones que distribuyan el internet ?, ¿hay empresas que puedan ofrecerte un servicio de internet a un buen costo? Si tu respuesta fue sí para alguna de estas preguntas, te recomendamos continuar con tu internet móvil o de fibra óptica y buscar otras soluciones en esta guía que te permitan mejorar tu conexión a internet. ¡Pero no te vayas! Te invitamos a continuar leyendo esta guía para que aprendas más del internet satelital y puedas tomas tus propias decisiones.
Si por el contrario respondiste no a todas las preguntas anteriores, cuentas con una mala conexión a internet y ya revisaste otras soluciones, te invitamos a contemplar la compra de internet a traves de tres opciones: Internet satelital, WiMax o Starlink.
Before we start, some ethical questions
Do you think that everyone, regardless of where they are, should have access to the Internet? In Colombia, for example, a Legislative Act of 2021 established and elevated the internet as a fundamental right, which makes it an obligation to extend internet coverage to communities and territories that are not connected. On the other hand, international organizations such as the UN affirm that denying access to the Internet is like denying the right to freedom of expression.
This may sound great, but the reality is complex and unequal. On the one hand, not all people and communities have internet: about one third of the world’s population remains offline, some 2.6 billion people. It is not in the interest of Internet companies to reach places where there is no infrastructure, as the chances of profitability are lower. This widens and maintains inequality in terms of Internet access. On the other hand, the deployment of thousands of satellites in low orbit has generated concerns about the environmental impact and the generation of space debris.
So, at SOLE Colombia, we see satellite internet as one of the existing options, especially designed for places that have no internet connection, nor nearby telecommunication towers to distribute it. If this is not your case, maybe you can find a more conscious and adjusted solution to your needs in the content of this guide.
How do I know if I need this solution?
Before we start, we would like to ask you some questions: Do you currently have regular or good quality fiber optic or mobile internet? Where you live, can you see telecommunication towers that distribute internet, are there companies that can offer you internet service at a good cost? If you answered yes to any of these questions, we recommend you to continue with your mobile or fiber optic internet and look for other solutions in this guide that will allow you to improve your internet connection. But don’t go away! We invite you to continue reading this guide to learn more about satellite internet and make your own decisions.
If you answered no to all of the above questions, have a bad internet connection and have already reviewed other solutions, we invite you to consider buying internet through three options: Satellite Internet, WiMax or Starlink.
Options to review
In this solution we will work with three technologies available in Colombia: Satellite Internet, WiMax and Starlink for the year 2024. The estimated reading time of this solution is about 15 minutes, but do not panic, you can read these recommendations with the help of other people. Remember that in SOLE Voltage we want to promote the collective use of the Internet.


Satellite Internet
The most popular rural internet option is satellite internet. Although the name is self-explanatory, it is the connection to the internet via satellites. The great advantage of this option is that it can reach anywhere, including the most remote rural areas! To access this technology the company will need to install a satellite dish in your home.
  


WiMax

Imagen tomada de wikipedia, es.wikipedia.org/wiki/WiMAX#/media/Archivo:Alvarion_CPE.jpg
El funcionamiento de WiMAX es sencillo, ya que es un repetidor de la empresa que quieres contratar emitiendo las señales de microondas que te llegan a la antena. Por lo tanto, lo primero que necesitas es contactar con una empresa que ofrezca estos servicios y que tenga un repetidor cerca de tu casa para poder enviarte la señal. Luego, tienes que poner una  antena en la fachada de tu casa. Esta antena tendrá que apuntar directamente al repetidor de la empresa que te va a dar el servicio o a un punto de conexión intermedio que se utilice para salvar los obstáculos que se interpongan entre tu antena y su repetidor. La instalación de la antena la hará la propia compañía.


Starlink

Image taken from Starlink, www.starlink.com/es/specifications
Starlink is Elon Musk’s satellite internet project. It is a particular satellite internet that facilitates connections especially in rural areas. The company claims to be the world’s first and largest satellite constellation that uses a low Earth orbit to offer broadband, high-speed, low-latency satellite Internet. This allows you to watch streaming content, play online games, make video calls and more. To get it up and running, the user buys a kit with everything needed, including the antenna to be placed outdoors, which automatically orients itself to establish a connection in a matter of minutes, as long as the sky is clear.


We already have an introduction of the available options, now we want you to know the criteria you should take into account to choose the option that suits you best.
What should I take into account to make this decision?
Availability: Are these options available for the place where I live?
Although this analysis was done in 2024 for Colombia, it may be useful for other countries. To know what is the availability of these three options you must take into account that, unlike WiMax, satellite Internet and Starlink have global coverage, so they will not depend exclusively on the providers in your region. For the WiMax option, the first thing you should do is to contact the companies that offer internet services in your region, they will be able to guide you and tell you if they offer this technology.
Budget: How much money can I pay?

The cost of WiMax service can be from 150,000 COP** per month with a payment for the equipment between **300,000 COP and $2,000,000 COP depending on the company you want to contract with.
The cost of the satellite internet service can be from 150,000 COP** per month with a payment for the equipment between **300,000 COP and $2,000,000 COP depending on the company you want to contract with.
The cost of Starlink service can be from 180,000 COP** per month with a one-time equipment payment of **1,900,000 COP.

Weather conditions: Can the weather affect the internet signal?

In the case of Starlink and satellite Internet , the quality of the Internet will depend on weather conditions. For the use of the satellite dish a clear sky is needed, for this reason the stability of the signal could be compromised by rain or thunderstorms.
In the case of WiMax, keep in mind that a direct contact with the repeater is necessary, this means that the antenna you install in your house has to be oriented directly to the place where the connection is being sent, and if possible avoiding obstacles that prevent direct vision, such as trees or buildings. Sometimes it may be necessary to install intermediate connection points to avoid obstacles.

Signal and coverage: Which option offers the best quality?


The advantage ofsatellite Internet is that it has global coverage, which means that people living in remote regions or rural areas can reliably access the Internet. One of the most outstanding advantages of satellite internet is its ability to provide a constant and stable connection. Unlike terrestrial connections that can be affected by interruptions in the infrastructure or adverse weather conditions. Satellite internet does not rely on cables. This guarantees a reliable and continuous connection, even in areas prone to natural disasters.


However, the disadvantage of satellite internet is that many providers offer a limited amount of data that can be downloaded and uploaded during a given period. If this limit is exceeded, the speed may be reduced or additional charges may apply.



In the case of WiMax, the advantage is that no home phone service is required. It is not a requirement to have a telephone line to access the Internet service.


However, a disadvantage is that the download Internet speed will be much higher than the upload speed. WiMAX connections can reach speeds of up to 1Gbps at fixed points, for example a home, and 365Mbps at mobile points. Even so, it will always depend on what the company from which you contract the service offers you. Keep in mind that the speed could be affected more easily during peak hours.


For its part, Starlink offers an easy installation that you and your community can carry out: the company offers the user to buy a kit with the necessary instructions to assemble it. Starlink also offers flexibility and mobility. You can access the Internet from any location covered by the satellite signal, making it an ideal choice for frequent travelers, remote workers, or those who need connectivity in temporary or expanding areas.


However, since the Starlink system relies on low orbiting satellites, capacity is limited and shared among users in a given area. In congested areas, this could result in reduced speed during peak hours, although its coverage is improving all the time. Some reports suggest that Starlink may experience interference issues, especially in densely populated areas or in regions with high satellite activity. For this reason, keep in mind that using Starlink requires a direct view of the sky, which may limit its viability in areas with significant obstructions such as tall trees or buildings.


What signal speed do I need?
By latency we mean the time it takes for the signal to travel from the satellite to Earth. In the case of Starlink , broadband Internet is high speed and low latency. It will have latencies of around 20ms, compared to the average of 600ms.
On the other hand, WiMax allows a fast and fluid connection with low latencies.
However, the speed of satellite internet can be slower compared to terrestrial connections. This can affect real-time activities, such as video conferencing or online gaming, where even small delays can be noticeable.

es/disconnected/convertirte-en-informaci.content:
Convertirte en información que viaja por el internet
Creado: 17 de diciembre de 2024 21:04
Etiquetas: Conocimiento, Tarjeta
![Versión Voltaje Virtual_20241202_SOLE_Desconectado v2 (3).png](Convertirte en información que viaja por el intern ff19a0c6e05445468df99e821229a9fd/Versin_Voltaje_Virtual_20241202_SOLE_Desconectado_v2_(3).png)
¿Cómo funciona el internet?
Piensa cuando vas a una restaurante a pides una taza de café. Tú, como cliente, le pides o consultas al mesero, y este va a la cocina y vuelve un tiempo después y te sirve la taza de café lista, como un buen servidor. No tienes muy claro cómo la preparó, pero sabes que es una taza de café cuando la pruebas. El Internet funciona de manera similar. Veamos.
Cuando te conectas a internet y tienes una pregunta, lo que haces es consultarla desde un celular o computador y estás comunicándote con muchos computadores de otras personas o empresas que almacenan eso que quieres encontrar.
La información que quieres consultar puede estar una página web, un video, una foto, una videollamada, un archivo o un mensaje. Estos son algunos de los formatos de archivos digitales y que se envían por internet. Al celular, computador o tableta desde la que te conectas a internet se le llama cliente.
El computador donde se almacena la información que estas consultando se le llama el servidor.

es/disconnected/desconectado-sole-voltaj.title: ¿Desconectado?
es/disconnected/desconectado-sole-voltaj.content:
¿Desconectado?
SOLE Voltaje Desconectado
En el 2024 el equipo de SOLE Colombia diseñó un prototipo para que cualquier persona, en cualquier parte del mundo y sin importar los conocimientos previos, pudiera entender, de manera práctica y divertida, cómo funciona el internet sin internet. Este prototipo se llama Desconectado. Después de varias pruebas, desarrollamos este juego de cartas que nos invitan a navegar por historias, aprendizajes e información muy valiosa. Una vez hayas explorado este juego creemos que estarás listo para identificar qué tan buena es tu señal de internet, cómo funciona y podrás evaluar las mejores soluciones para cualquier problema de conectividad que tengas.
Lo interesante de este juego de cartas es que puede ampliarse tanto como queramos. Eso quiere decir que vamos a estar diseñando y ampliando las cartas de este juego con base en los aprendizajes y aportes de las comunidades con las que trabajamos.
Este juego se divide en 3 tipos de cartas:

Cartas Cacharreras
Cartas Navegadoras
Cartas Conectivas

Este juego no tiene un orden específico, por lo que puedes empezar por cualquier de los tres tipos de cartas. ¡Empecemos!
Descarga aquí el juego de cartas del Desconectado
Instrucciones para jugar SOLE Voltaje Desconectado
Cartas Cacharreras: ¿Cómo está tu señal?
Para entender cómo funciona el internet en cualquier parte del mundo en el que estés, puedes empezar por cacharrear la señal que tengas. Pero ¿qué señal tienes? ¿Cómo funciona? Tenemos dos cartas que te ayudarán a responder estas preguntas en la práctica: **¿cómo cacharrear tu señal móvil?** o ¿cómo cacharrear tu señal WiFi? Esta primera distinción te permitirá distinguir cómo llega la señal de internet a cualquier dispositivo. Abre cualquiera de las dos cartas y sigue las instrucciones para empezar a navegar.
[Sin título](¿Desconectado 1292bd68c5b681cba770d407771654ee/Sin título 1602bd68c5b680f7b1fdff1931ec64f5.csv)
Cartas Navegadoras: ¿Qué te gustaría más?
Estas cartas te ayudarán a navegar por el internet mientras aprendes sobre la importancia de hacernos Grandes Preguntas. También aprenderás sobre cómo viaja el internet, qué tan rápido es, qué señal tienes, cómo aprovecharla y mucho más.Para jugar este juego puedes seguir los siguientes pasos:

Escoge 2 cartas aleatorias y coloca en medio la carta ¿qué te gustaría más?

[Sin título](¿Desconectado 1292bd68c5b681cba770d407771654ee/Sin título 7a3aa606c7184c28b51833e1547881a6.csv)

Responde qué te gustaría más: ¿Cuál de las dos cartas prefieres? ¿Ser inter para viajar por un cable a través de la tierra y los oceanos o Viajar a la velocidad de la luz? Combina las cartas como lo desees.
Voltea la carta que escogiste, lee lo que dice y soluciona los retos que aparecen allí. Es muy probable que leas cartas que están conectadas con otras. Puedes navegar tan profundo como desees.
Si estás con tus amigos, familiares o conocidos puedes hacer varias rondas en las que cada uno responde y comparte qué le gustaría más, leyendo la información y solucionando en equipo los retos que están allí. Te invitamos a hacer las variaciones que más te gusten de este juego.

[Sin título](¿Desconectado 1292bd68c5b681cba770d407771654ee/Sin título 56245c00fa4f4ed0ac0744ad24fa9b46.csv)
Cartas Conectivas: ¿Qué quieres hacer?
Estas cartas te mostrarán diferentes soluciones de conectividad que podrás encontrar en esta página de Desconectado. Puedes abrir cualquier carta, sigue las instrucciones y reconocerás si esa solución te sirve o no para aquello que quieres aprender o solucionar. Estas cartas son conectivas porque te llevarán a encontrar soluciones para conectarte a internet.
Dependiendo de los problemas de conectividad o intereses de aprendizaje que tengas, encontrarás tres tipos de cartas para esta categoría:

Soluciones para conseguir el internet
Soluciones para mejorar el internet
Soluciones para compartir el internet

¿Cuáles son las diferencias entre estas cartas? Te invitamos a abrir cualquier de ellas para descubrirlo.
[Sin título](¿Desconectado 1292bd68c5b681cba770d407771654ee/Sin título 1602bd68c5b6803ab875f727ba3b1662.csv)
[Sin título](¿Desconectado 1292bd68c5b681cba770d407771654ee/Sin título f577af783fe44a979b767cd00ae77a53.csv)
[Sin título](¿Desconectado 1292bd68c5b681cba770d407771654ee/Sin título 604eef57b3a743ecaf927d3477397737.csv)
¿Quieres llevar alguna solución de SOLE Voltaje a un contexto real desconectado?
En todas las Inspiraciones y Soluciones puedes descargar el material en formato pdf. Imprime el material o cópialo a una memoria USB y podrás llevarlo a los lugares en donde no tienes conectividad para tratar de solucionar sus problemas.
¿Cuales son los retos de conectividad?
SOLE Voltaje fue imaginado para la gente que retos de conectividad diversos. Después de una encuesta que hicimos en 2020 en SOLE Colombia, descubrimos que la mitad de las personas con las que nos relacionamos no tenían Internet por las siguientes 4 razones:


No hay señal: En los lugares en donde viven no hay cobertura ni de señal móvil o de señal por cable. En algunos de los lugares, especialmente los rurales dispersos, hay escuelas públicas con conectividad por internet satelital puesto por el gobierno pero cuya calidad y constancia es difícil de establecer.


Las señal el mala: En otros lugares la señal es intermitente. No les permitía hacer una videollamada o ver un video por streaming. Usualmente, les exigía tener que moverse por su territorio para ubicar la mejor posibilidad para conectase.


No tienen dinero para pagarlo: Puede que haya señal móvil o por cable, sin embargo, representa un costo muy alto para sus gastos personales o familiares.


No saben para qué es el Internet: Muchas personas argumentan que no tienen Internet por alguna de las razones anteriores pero también se puede inferir que mucha gente no sabe para qué es el Internet, pues están dispuestos a pagar otros servicios como TV satelital en vez de Internet. En muchas comunidades se cree que Internet es Facebook y Whatsapp pues es lo que viene gratis con su plan de telefonía móvil.

es/disconnected/descubrir-donde-esta-el-.title: Descubrir dónde está el internet
es/disconnected/descubrir-donde-esta-el-.content:
Descubrir dónde está el internet
Creado: 17 de diciembre de 2024 20:22
Etiquetas: Conocimiento, Tarjeta

Cuando piensas en el internet, ¿qué es lo primero que se te viene a la cabeza?
Si pensamos en que las bibliotecas son un repositorio del conocimiento de los humanos escrito en libros; que hoy día los computadores tienen esa información y mucha otra está almacenada como ceros y unos en su memoria; entonces, podríamos imaginar el Internet como la suma de toda la información que se crea y se guarda en todos los computadores del planeta que están conectados a través de una red de cables y señales inalámbricas y que pueden intercambiar esa información entre sí.
El Internet es mucho más que eso, pero en corto: es una gran red descentralizada de computadores que se comunican entre sí.
Hay otras redes de comunicación en el mundo, por ejemplo, el correo postal, la telefonía, la radio o la televisión. Una gran diferencia entre estas y el Internet, es que en el Internet las personas pueden comunicarse en ambas vías e intercambiar información digital muy rápidamente - ¡a la velocidad de la luz!

es/disconnected/instrucciones-para-jugar.title: Instrucciones para jugar SOLE Voltaje Desconectado
es/disconnected/instrucciones-para-jugar.content:
Instrucciones para jugar SOLE Voltaje Desconectado
Cómo mejorar el Internet sin Internet
Descarga las Instrucciones en PDF
Instrucciones_para_jugar_SOLE_Voltaje_Desconectado.pdf
Propósito: que cualquier persona, en cualquier parte del mundo y sin importar los conocimientos previos, pueda entender, de manera práctica y divertida, cómo funciona el internet sin internet.
Duración: 1.5 horas
Usa el juego de cartas para entre 2 y 10 jugadores que encuentras en
¿Desconectado?
¿Cómo jugarlo?


[Nutrición]: Cartas Navegadoras: ¿Qué te gustaría más? (30 min)
Estas cartas les ayudarán a navegar por el internet mientras aprenden sobre la importancia de hacernos Grandes Preguntas. También aprenderán sobre cómo viaja el internet, qué tan rápido es, qué señal tienes, cómo aprovecharla y mucho más.
 
Para jugar este juego puedes seguir los siguientes pasos:

Reparte aleatoriamente 2 o 3 Cartas Navegadoras a cada uno de los participantes, dependiendo de cuántos jugadores tengas, mostrando la cara que tiene las imágenes, como si estuvieran sacando cartas de una baraja y coloca en medio la carta ¿qué te gustaría más?
Los jugadores, por parejas o el grupo entero, responden qué les gustaría más: ¿Cuál de las dos cartas prefieres? ¿Ser internet para viajar por un cable a través de la tierra y los oceanos o Viajar a la velocidad de la luz? Combina las cartas como lo desees.
Voltean la carta que escogieron, leen lo que dice en voz alta y conectan con las otras Cartas que aparecen allí.
Hacen varias rondas en las que cada uno comparte qué le gustaría más, leyendo la información y entendiendo en equipo los conceptos que están allí.
¿Aprendieron algo nuevo? ¿Qué aprendieron?



[Creación]: Cartas Cacharreras: ¿Cómo está tu señal? y Cartas Conectivas: ¿Qué quieren hacer? (30 min)
Para entender cómo funciona el internet en cualquier parte del mundo en el que estén, pueden empezar por cacharrear la señal que tengan. Pero ¿qué señal tienen? ¿Cómo funciona? Tenemos dos Cartas Cacharreras que les ayudarán a responder estas preguntas en la práctica: **¿cómo cacharrear tu señal móvil?** o ¿cómo cacharrear tu señal WiFi? Esta primera distinción les permitirá distinguir cómo llega la señal de internet a cualquier dispositivo.
 


Divide el grupo en dos y escojan cualquiera de las dos cartas. Luego sigan las instrucciones para empezar a navegar.

Si sí hay señal de Internet, sigan  las instrucciones de las Cartas.
Si no hay señal de Internet, ¿a dónde van a buscarlo?

Si no está muy lejos vayan a ese lugar y de nuevo sigan las instrucciones de las Cartas.
Si está muy lejos la señal pueden seguir al paso 2b.





Una vez hayan completado el ejercicio, compartan con el resto del grupo cuál fue la velocidad de descarga según el operador o la fuente de Wifi.


¿Qué nivel de intensidad tiene? ¿Cuál es más rápido? ¿Qué pueden hacer con es velocidad de descarga según la tarjeta? ¿Cuánto pagan por su plan vs. qué velocidad les da?


Si no tenemos señal, ¿qué otras alternativas creen que podríamos tener para poder responder una Gran Pregunta que tengamos? Leamos juntos la Carta de Despertar tu curiosidad y luego exploremos todas las Cartas para ver qué podríamos hacer para tener responder una Gran Pregunta y también para conseguir internet.
Despertar tu curiosidad




Luego cuéntales que con la señal que tienen - o no - hay varias opciones. Presenta las  Cartas Conectivas: les mostrarán diferentes soluciones de conectividad que podrán encontrar en la página web de Desconectado o impresas.
 
Pueden abrir cualquier carta, seguir las instrucciones y reconocerán si esa solución les sirve o no para aquello que quieren aprender o solucionar. Estas cartas son conectivas porque les llevarán a encontrar soluciones para conectarse a Internet.
Dependiendo de los problemas de conectividad o intereses de aprendizaje que tengas, encontrarás tres tipos de cartas para esta categoría:

Soluciones para conseguir el internet
Soluciones para mejorar el internet
Soluciones para compartir el internet

¿Cuáles son las diferencias entre estas cartas? Los invitamos a abrir cualquier de ellas para descubrirlo.
Permite que cada persona escoja una solución e invítalos a que lean para presentarla al resto del grupo.




[Exposición]: Cada participante presenta al resto del grupo la solución que leyó y luego facilita una conversación (30 min)

¿Cuál de estas soluciones le gustó más al grupo? ¿Por qué les gusto?
¿Cuál no tanto? ¿Por qué?
¿Qué dudas surgieron leyendo las soluciones?
¿Cuáles podríamos implementar para nuestro contexto?
¿Qué otros contextos o comunidades conocemos que tengan retos de conectividad? ¿Cuál de esas soluciones les podría servir?
¿Cuándo empezamos? Arrancar a hacerla es la actitud cacharrera que va lograr que todos nos podamos conectar a crear el mundo que queremos juntos.

Jugar a ser electricidad y ondas
Creado: 17 de diciembre de 2024 21:07

![Versión Voltaje Virtual_20241202_SOLE_Desconectado v2 (4).png](Jugar a ser electricidad y ondas b8d037d0921f4de08f4bed128642eaa6/Versin_Voltaje_Virtual_20241202_SOLE_Desconectado_v2_(4).png)
¿Cómo se transmite la señal de internet?
Para entender qué es un servidor y un cliente,  revisa la carta “Convertirte en información que viaja por el internet.”
Para que la información que envía un servidor llegue a tu casa, barrio, vereda o comunidad, el cliente que usas se conecta a Internet. Tomemos, por ejemplo, tu teléfono celular en algún lugar en Colombia y que la respuesta se encuentre en un servidor en Europa. Esta es la gran aventura que toma tu pregunta.
Tu celular se conecta por ondas electromagnéticas o inalámbricas a un torre de telefonía celular o a varias. Tu pregunta viaja en forma de ceros “0” y unos “1” a alguna de esas torres y baja por un cable que se mete bajo tierra y que va hasta algún lugar central de cables. Luego se redirecciona a un puerto marítimo en donde ese cable se conecta con un cable submarino. Este va debajo del oceano al otro continente y luego sale del agua a otros punto de cables que lleva tu pregunta al lugar donde está el servidor en donde se encuentra tu respuesta. El servidor recibe tu pregunta y responde con la información que tiene almacenada - también en ceros “0” y unos “1”- y se envía de regreso por esa misma ruta hasta tu teléfono. ¡Y todo eso ocurre en cuestión de milisegundos! ¡Es increíble¡ ¿No te parece?
