Boost your mobile signal
Welcome
Hi, I’m Sanjay and I welcome you to SOLE Voltage. I’m not an expert on connectivity issues, but knowing some tricks on how to improve my signal has made my life easier and I’m going to accompany you to discover them. I would love it if, at the end, you could tell me if you liked this solution, if it worked for you and how it made you feel. Here we go!
What is amplifying your mobile signal inside a space?
Amplifying the mobile signal of your cell phone means that, with some adjustments, you can increase the strength of the signal received and emitted by your phone, which improves the quality and reliability of the connection.
What is it good for?
Are you not being heard, or are you being cut off when you talk on the phone? Are you going to do a SOLE and the pages are not loading or the search is slow? You can look for a stronger signal for your phone to get better service and speed up your SOLE sessions. Here are some simple tricks to improve your mobile connection at home and facilitate collaborative learning in your community.
What do you need?

Cell phone
Mobile data connection

How to do it?


Step 1: Change room or room
If you are at home, try different rooms to find the best signal. Consider the direction of the cell tower and building materials that could affect the connection. Find the optimal location to boost the signal.


Step 2: Remove your phone case
Remove any barriers that may be affecting your signal. Some poorly designed cases block the antenna, so remove the case and see if reception improves. Sometimes simplicity is the solution.


Moment 3: Turn Airplane Mode On and Off
Give your phone a deep breath. Forcing network scanning by turning airplane mode on and off can be helpful, especially after changing locations. This step helps your phone automatically select the best available signal.


How do I know if this solution works?
By following these steps, you are resetting and improving your mobile connection settings. This will not only enhance your browsing experience, but also allow you to share this signal with other devices during your SOLE sessions.
Why would this solution work?
Restarting the connection is a great step to improve the speed and stability of your signal. However, keep in mind that the signal quality also depends on the coverage in your geographical area - these tricks will allow you to browse the Internet faster, but the area must have good carrier coverage!
Remember, for SOLE-savvy communities, having a solid connection is crucial. Learning to share the Internet is an important step for future computer moments, facilitating group learning with larger screens - sharing the connection is the first step towards an even more enriching SOLE! 📶✨

Buying the best computer for me
Welcome
Hi, I’m Nicolas and, like you, I’ve been learning about how to improve my internet connection. I am not an expert on the subject, but by searching the internet, tutorials and learning from trial and error I have managed to improve the quality of the internet in areas without good connectivity.
What is how to buy a computer for you?
In this solution you will be able to clarify some important things to make the decision. On the one hand, differentiate the main characteristics of a computer and a series of recommendations based on these characteristics. You can also take into account for the analysis your needs and capabilities. I hope you can feel accompanied and confident as you go through the selection of a computer.
What is it for?
Making a decision about a purchase in areas in which we are not experts can be a difficult exercise. For this reason, we have developed this solution that serves to accompany you in this process. In the end, this solution helps you to make an informed decision and not spend too much money or end up buying a computer that does not meet your requirements.
How do I know if I need it?
To know if you need, or not, to make a purchase, there are two fundamental criteria:

Reflect deeply and meditatively if you need it, for this ask yourself: What need is solving the purchase of a computer, can this need be solved in another way? For example, can you do the same with the cell phone you currently have, or perhaps with a tablet?
If you have already corroborated that the need you are considering can only be solved with access to a computer, it is time to look at other alternatives before purchasing. For example, can you borrow a computer from the school or library, can you get a donated computer from a family member or a company?

If you have exhausted the above options and have definitely decided to buy a computer, this solution is right for you.


What are the potentialities of a computer compared to a cell phone?
Speed and capacity are two of the great advantages that computers have over phones. With a computer, you have a keyboard and mouse at your disposal, which allows you to type and navigate through menus much faster. In addition, the larger screen of a computer allows you to organize your digital space in a way that a small phone screen cannot. It also allows you to
These factors not only save you time; they also allow you to type and navigate menus much faster.
These factors not only save you time; they also allow you to multitask. On a computer, you can more easily switch between applications and even have them conveniently on the screen at the same time. For example, you can have one window open with your resume and another open with a job you’re looking for. Or if you’re looking for the best deal, you can have multiple product pages open at the same time for easy comparison.
  


Options to review


Desktop Computer
This is a computer designed to be installed in a static location, such as a desk or table. The hardware components are usually a computer case that houses the motherboard with the respective components.



Notebook computer
Also known as a laptop, this is a computer that can be moved or transported with relative ease. Laptops are small, lightweight and are specially designed so that their batteries are capable of powering them for an extended period of time (usually 4 to 5 hours). Screen sizes range from 11 to 15 inches.



Pros and cons








































CategoryDesktopLaptopPortabilityIt is in a fixed location.Can be easily transported.CostIt is more economical.It is more expensive.Upgrade and CustomizationYour hardware components can be easily upgraded and improved. This makes it easy to customize it to your needs.It is increasingly difficult to upgrade your hardware components, as most come integrated. In some you can change the RAM and hard disk.Energy independenceIt must always be connected to an electrical power source.Since it has a battery, it can be disconnected for a few hours from a power source, but over time this battery wears out and lasts less time until it needs to be replaced.Energy consumptionConsume more energyThey consume less energy because their components are more compact.SpaceThey take up more space.They take up little space.


What should I consider when making this decision?


Moment 0: Before starting: ALERT! What is hardware and software?
It is important to know that there are two basic components in a computer: Hardware and software:

Hardware: It is the set of components that make up the material part of a computer.
Software: It is the set of programs, instructions, data and computer rules to execute certain tasks in a computer.

Next we will explain which are the main components of the hardware of a computer that are important at the time of buying it.
Element
Processor
Storage
RAM Memory
Graphics card
Peripherals
Display
Battery
Image







Description
This is the brain of the machine, undoubtedly one of the fundamental factors to take into account. Remember that depending on the power of this element, the computer will be able to execute the instructions you give it faster.
The hard disk marks the storage capacity of your computer.
The RAM memory temporarily stores the data of the applications that are running. The more RAM memory your computer has, the greater the capacity to run different programs at the same time in an optimal way.
The graphics card is responsible for processing data related to images and videos that are played on the computer.
They refer to the input and output ports of other devices that you will connect to your computer. For example: USB ports, audio outputs, HDMI connections, etc.
It is the one that allows you to see what you are doing on your computer.
It only applies to laptops and determines the time of use you have without being connected to the power.


Moment 1: The fundamental criteria
Now that you know each of the main hardware components, we will tell you which are the characteristics that differentiate their performance, cost and the questions you should ask yourself to choose one or another option.


















































ElementDetailRelevant questionsProcessorIf you are looking for a fast computer, which performs tasks effectively and without getting slow, the number of cores must be taken into account. In addition, you should detail the frequency or speed of work. The higher the number the better the performance, this factor is measured in Ghz (gigahertz). So 3Ghz is much better than 2.5 Ghz. As for brands this is the recommendation: If you can afford it, go for an Intel; if you need something cheaper, an AMD. And if you are really tight on money, go for a Celeron.How many programs can you use at the same time, what activities will you do with your computer, are you going to design models, browse the internet, play games, Intel or AMD, how many cores, how many cores?Storage500 GB is more than enough for a “normal” home use. If you store movies, series, etc, you may need to choose a 1 TB (terabyte) hard drive or higher. Speed is also critical. It is measured in revolutions per minute (rpm) the higher the speed, the better the reading and writing of data. Currently there are two different technologies: The traditional hard disk drive (HDD), which is slower, but cheaper. The other is thesolid state disk (SSD), which is faster but more expensive.Solid state drive or hard disk, how much data will you store, do I want the computer to start up quickly?RAM memoryThe more RAM your computer has, the greater its capacity to run different programs at the same time in an optimal way. Calculating how much RAM you need for your computer is 100% related to how you use it. The more programs you use (such as design programs, editing, among others), the more RAM you will need. If you are going to use design programs, video games or simply have the money and want a very fast computer, buy 16GB; if your use is for conventional tasks (writing, browsing, etc) 8 GB will be enough; if you do not have much budget you should be satisfied with 4 GB and be willing to let the computer not be very fast.What programs will I use, how many GB do I need?Graphics cardIt can be an important factor or not depending on the use you are going to give it, if in your case you only need it for basic tasks standard use, any graphics card works. But, if you require graphic work or gaming, a dedicated graphics card is ideal. Don’t complicate your life. For standard use you don’t need a spectacular graphics card. Any of the Radeon or Nvidia brands will give you great service.Am I going to use it for video games or design programs, Nvidia and Radeon?PeripheralsIf you build a desktop computer you can attach an infinite number of peripherals according to your needs. On the other hand, in laptops most options try to be as simple and minimalist as possible, so they have fewer and fewer inputs.How many USB ports do you need? Do you need to connect the computer to a screen or TV? Audio outputs?ScreenThe interaction with a screen is becoming more recurrent, so it is important that it gives you comfort and takes care of your eyesight, for this we must take into account: Size: If you need to carry the computer from one place to another, the ideal is 14 inches, but if your purpose is graphic work you need a larger size. Resolution: It is useless to buy a big screen with a bad resolution. From 1080 is full HD and is a pretty good resolution. Monitors up to 23” are recommended to avoid the pixelated effect caused by low resolution images.How many inches do I need, what resolution is enough for my requirements, do you need to run several programs at the same time, design or watch your favorite movies?BatteryThis will depend on the number of cells, each manufacturer specifies this information and its correspondence to the number of hours of independence.Do you need to move with your computer between different places, how much time of energy independence do you need?AudioThis will depend on the speakers you buy in the case of a desktop computer, in laptops this feature is not their forte, but regularly the “gamer” computers come with a great sound.Do you need great sound for your parties or for watching movies or do you already have a great speaker that you can connect to your computer?


Moment 2: Let’s make the decision
Now that you know the basics it’s time to make a decision, for this we have developed a series of simple questions, depending on your answer we would recommend one or another hardware feature:
Criterion 0: Set a budget
Now it is time to define a budget, for this you can do the math of how many days of work per month it represents to buy this computer. Finally, the decision will fall on this point, this purchase can easily mean more than a month of work, so it is very important to try to be as informed as possible before deciding.
Criterion 1: Usage habits
Now let’s remember some of the most relevant questions when defining our usage habits:

Do I need the computer to be portable or do I prefer to use it in one place?
Am I going to use it for video games and design programs or for office work?
How much information will I store?
Do I need to use several programs at the same time?

With these questions and your budget you can decide on a smaller list of options. choose wisely.


Don’t be fooled
It is important to remember that when you go to a store a salesperson is usually looking for the “star product”, however many times the cost of computers from 6 months or a year ago are significantly lower than the technologies of that moment. Sometimes, you can find second hand computers that have been in good hands and make a good deal. On the other hand, it only remains for me to recommend that if possible you buy a desktop computer or a laptop that allows you to upgrade its hardware.
The computer I am writing from I bought it 13 years ago, it has gone through hard drive replacement and RAM upgrade, plus a few fixes, but now it works fine and has been a great investment for the long term.
Finally, remember that now it is very easy to find pages and [people](
  
  
&ab_channel=RadioTech) dedicated exclusively to make [reviews](
  
  
&ab_channel=IsaMarcial) and [evaluate](
  
  
&ab_channel=dBeta) the performance of computers, also some [pages allow you to compare between several options](versus.com/es/laptop), once you have selected the computers available on the market that best suit your case use these pages and user comments to make a more accurate decision. 
Another recommendation that never hurts, is to be guided by the reputation of the brand and the seller. In my experience I recommend the ASUS brand in terms of quality-price ratio, although from SOLE, we have also done well with the Lenovo brand.
How much is enough?
This question is difficult to answer, but I think we can rephrase it as follows: Does the option you chose meet the need and intention you projected at the beginning? In my case, 13 years ago I bought a computer for college, but also one that would allow me to play video games, download and watch a lot of movies. That is to say, going for the minimum (to be useful for college) I should have selected a laptop, light weight, with good battery, a small screen, an intermediate processor, 8GB of RAM and a generic graphics card. However, I did the opposite, I selected a large, heavy, low-battery computer with a dedicated graphics card, what they would say a “gamer” computer: The ASUS N53SV.
By not meditating well my decision I ended up buying a computer too big and heavy for its transport and with low battery. Finally its main function was to serve for the university, the video games and movies was something secondary. At the moment, although I use it, I hardly transport it, it ended up being in practice a desktop computer. So from SOLE Voltage, we do not want you to fall into mistakes like mine! Always remember that many times “less is more”.
With this we have just seen, you can no longer put your fingers in your mouth, it’s time to make the decision!

Welcome
Hi, I’m Nicolas and I’m learning about how the internet works. I’m not an expert on the subject, but through internet searches, tutorials and, above all, a lot of curiosity, I’ve learned how to set up functional internet solutions.
What is choosing an internet service for non-interconnected locations?
In this particular solution we will learn how to choose a satellite internet service for rural or remote areas that do not have Wi-fi or cable internet connection. For this wewill look at three technologies available in Colombia: Satellite dish, WiMax and Starlink.
What is it for?
This solution is useful to have more clarity about which satellite internet service you can choose if you are located in areas that do not have Wi-fi or cable internet connection.
How do I know if I need it?
Now, the quality of the internet service you can choose will depend on your possibilities and needs, as well as the availability of internet providers in your region. This solution is an option that you can pay for together with the people in the community where you live.
Options to review

What you need:

A budget.
A list of internet providers in your region.
A lot of curiosity!
It may help to have people in your community to review the information with, making a decision together will be easier and more profitable for everyone.



How to do it?


Moment 0: What are the types of internet connections that serve non-interconnected regions?
Now let’s get down to business. Digital technologies are changing rapidly over the years. In this article we want to present you an investigation of the options available in Colombia for 2024: satellite dish, WiMax and Starlink.


Satellite dish

The most popular internet option for rural or remote areas these days is the satellite dish. The great advantage of this solution is its coverage, accessibility and price, which makes it a viable and functional option.  To access this technology, the company in charge must install a satellite dish in your home.


WiMax

Image taken from wikipedia, es.wikipedia.org/wiki/WiMAX#/media/Archivo:Alvarion_CPE.jpg
The first thing you need to do is to contact a company that offers these services and has a repeater near your house to send you the internet signal. Next, you need to put an antenna on the front of your house. This antenna will have to point directly to the repeater of the company that is going to give you the service or to an intermediate connection point that is used to save the obstacles that are interposed between your antenna and its repeater. The installation of the antenna will be done by the company itself.


Starlink

Image taken from Starlink, www.starlink.com/es/specifications
Starlink is Elon Musk’s satellite internet project. It is a particular satellite internet that facilitates connections especially in rural areas. The company claims to be the world’s first and largest satellite constellation that uses a low Earth orbit to offer broadband, high-speed, low-latency satellite Internet, which allows you to watch streaming content, play online games, make video calls and more. To get it up and running, you must purchase an antenna kit to be placed outside your home that automatically orients itself to establish a connection in a matter of minutes, provided you have a clear view of the sky.




We already have an introduction of the available options, now we can move on to  moment 1 in which we will discuss the advantages and disadvantages of each option.


Moment 1: Advantages and disadvantages of satellite dish connection
Advantages

Global coverage: This means that people living in remote regions or rural areas can reliably access the Internet.
Fast access: Faster than DSL and dial-upservices with speeds of up to 25 Mbps and 100 Mbps. While satellite Internet used to have a reputation for being slow, it is now possible to enjoy speeds comparable to terrestrial connections.
Constant connectivity: One of the most outstanding advantages of the satellite dish is its ability to provide a constant and stable connection. Unlike terrestrial connections that can be affected by infrastructure disruptions or adverse weather conditions, satellite internet does not rely on physical cables and relies on orbiting satellites for data transmission. This guarantees a reliable and continuous connection, even in areas prone to natural disasters.
High flexibility and mobility: Satellite Internet also offers flexibility and mobility. You can access the Internet from any location covered by the satellite signal, making it an ideal choice for frequent travelers, remote workers or those who need connectivity in temporary or expanding areas.
No residential telephone service is required: It is not a requirement to have a telephone line to access this Internet service.

Disadvantages

High latency: One of the main disadvantages of the satellite dish is latency, i.e. the time it takes for the signal to travel from the satellite to the Earth. Due to the distance the signal must travel, latency can be higher compared to terrestrial connections. This can affect real-time activities, such as video conferencing or online gaming, where even small delays can be noticeable.
High cost: Satellite internet tends to be more expensive compared to other connectivity options. Service prices are higher than other types of internet, due to expensive equipment, operating and satellite costs.
Weather conditions: The good performance of satellite internet may depend on good weather conditions. A clear sky is necessary for the use of the satellite dish. Signal stability may be compromised by rain or thunderstorms.
Data limitations: Many satellite Internet providers apply monthly data limits in their plans. This means that users have a limited amount of data they can download and upload during a given period. If this limit is exceeded, the speed may be reduced or additional charges may apply.



Moment 2: Advantages and disadvantages of WiMax connection
Advantages

High fluidity and low latency: This allows for a fast and fluid connection with low latencies.
No need for a residential telephone service: It is not a requirement to have a telephone line to access the Internet service.
VoIP calls: There will be companies that with the installation of this technology will allow you to make VoIP calls (it is a technology that allows you to make and receive voice calls over the Internet).

Disadvantages

Direct contact with the repeater is necessary: This means that the antenna you install in your house has to be oriented directly to the place from where the connection is being sent, and if possible avoiding obstacles that prevent direct vision, such as trees or buildings. This can sometimes make it necessary to install intermediate connection points to avoid obstacles.
Asymmetrical speeds: this means that the download speed will be much higher than the upload speed. WiMAX connections can reach speeds of up to 1Gbps at fixed points, for example a house, and 365Mbps at mobile points. Even so, it will always depend on what the company from which you contract the service offers you.
Congestion traffic: Speed could be affected more easily during peak hours.



Moment 3: Advantages and disadvantages of Starlink connection
Advantages

Easy installation: The user buys a kit and can assemble it autonomously.
High fluency and low latency: Broadband Internet at high speed and low latency. You will have latencies of around 20ms, compared to the average of 600ms.
High flexibility and mobility: Starlink also offers flexibility and mobility. You can access the Internet from any location covered by the satellite signal, making it an ideal choice for frequent travelers, remote workers or those who need connectivity in temporary or expanding areas.
Possibility of full refund of the cost of the equipment in the first month: If you purchase the service directly with Starlink there is this possibility: ****“Try it for 30 days and, if you are not satisfied, return the equipment and get a full refund,” says Starlink on its website.

Disadvantages

Weather conditions: good satellite internet performance may depend on good weather conditions. A clear sky is needed for satellite dish use. Signal stability may be compromised by rain or thunderstorms.
High cost: Starlink satellite internet tends to be more expensive compared to other connectivity options. This is due to the high costs associated with launching and maintaining satellites, as well as the infrastructure needed on Earth to operate the ground stations. The cost of this service is 300,000 COP** per month with a one-time equipment payment of **1’900,000 COP.
Capacity limitations: Since the Starlink system is based on low orbiting satellites, capacity is limited and is shared among users in a given area. In congested areas, this could result in reduced speed during peak hours.
Interference issues: Some reports suggest that Starlink may experience interference issues, especially in densely populated areas or in regions with high satellite activity.
Environmental impact: The deployment of thousands of satellites in low orbit has raised concerns about environmental impact and space debris generation.
Need for direct view to the sky: To use Starlink, a direct view to the sky is required, which may limit its viability in areas with significant obstructions such as tall trees or buildings.



Moment 4: How do I choose the best option for my community?
Now that you are clearer about each of the three options, their advantages and disadvantages, you can make a more informed decision together with your community. We consider the following to be important elements when choosing an option:

Availability

Although this analysis was done in 2024 for Colombia, it may be useful for other countries. However, the first thing to do is to contact the companies that offer internet services in your region, they will be able to guide you better and tell you if they offer WiMax technology. But remember that their interest is to sell, but you are the one who decides. Satellite internet and Starlink have global coverage so you will not depend exclusively on the providers in your region.

Budget

First of all, define your budget, for this you can calculate how many days of work you are willing to invest together with your community to hire this service. Don’t get into debt for an internet plan!

Maxi Gagliano, www.pexels.com/photo/close-up-photo-of-money-4636069/

Reliability

It is important to know if the company you selected has a good reputation or not. You can find this out from other users who have hired them and it will be vital when you have any inconvenience or have to do any kind of maintenance on the equipment.

Usage habits

Depending on what your community uses the Internet for, you will be able to choose a technology that benefits you the most. Here you can evaluate if the latency is important because they need to make video calls or play online, if they are willing to hire a monthly payment service or simply as the use is occasional they only pay the internet service in the months of greater use, or if, simply, these options are not the most adequate and they prefer to continue without an internet connection.


Don’t be fooled
Define your usage and number of devices to estimate the speed and bandwidth needed, and then evaluate the technology available (satellite is a common option) and the provider’s reliability and technical support.
Research the provider’s reputation with neighbors and see if they offer specific plans for rural areas. Upload speed, download speed and latency should be adequate for your activities, and it is useful to ask about data restrictions and the quality of the provider’s infrastructure.
How much is enough?
One of these three solutions may be the right one to solve connectivity in your region, because they are all designed for remote urban locations and do not depend on a wired internet service for their operation.
You can take into account the following criteria and think about them according to the people and content you need to access:

For basic use (emails, social networks, browsing): A moderate download speed and a basic data plan might be sufficient.
For streaming and online work: A higher download speed and higher bandwidth is required to avoid interruptions.
For intensive upload usage (cloud, large files): It is important to look for a symmetrical connection, where the upload speed is close to the download speed.

Buying a cell phone that fits your capabilities and needs

Welcome
Hi I’m Nicolas, and like you, I’ve been progressively learning how to improve my connectivity to do SOLE. I’m not an expert on the subject, but through internet searches, tutorials and, above all, trial and error, I’ve learned a lot and have put together functional solutions.
What is buying the right cell phone for you?
In this particular solution we will learn how to buy a cell phone according to your possibilities and needs. Below you will find a series of information, criteria and tips that try to be as clear as possible so you can feel accompanied in making a decision on what cell phone you can buy. The estimated reading time is about 12 minutes and consists of 10 items, butdo not panic, you can read these items with the help of others. Remember that in SOLE Voltage we want to promote the collective use of the Internet.
What is it for?
In this solution you will find a few practical tips to help you make a much more informed decision about which cell phones are right for you.
Before we start, some ethical issues!
At SOLE Voltage we talk from supporting people clarify the ethical implication of a decision by problematizing the circumstance that leads you to make that decision. This solution starts from the assumption that you want to buy a cell phone, but if you really need it, this is not always the best option for you. Sometimes you have an old cell phone that a family member can give you or, for different reasons, you prefer not to have a cell phone and it is a better option for you to have a computer. If, definitely after making a sweep of your options you consider that you need to buy a cell phone, this is the right place for you! Here is some advice on what to consider when buying a cell phone.
What do you need?

Save money for the purchase.
Internet access.
A reliable store or dealer.
Curiosity.

How to do it?


Moment 0: How to know if I need to buy a cell phone?
One of the characteristics of our current times is the great development of international and national markets, our cell phones are made in China and we can buy them in Colombia, we can go to the market and buy rice brought from Brazil. In addition, we find disproportionate consumption options, we can buy white rice, yellow rice, bulk rice, lemon flavored rice, etc.. There are endless options to become consumers of products that, many times, we do not need, so we end up buying non-nutritious food, and we fall into one more expense that does not satisfy the main function of food, to nourish us; in the same way, we fill ourselves with endless merchandise at home that ends up piled up or discarded because, in the end, it was not useful for anything. This is why we want to promote responsible consumption. In the case of a cell phone, we suggest you ask yourself the following questions to find out if it is a responsible purchase:

Do you need to buy a cell phone or do you have other options to access the internet and make calls?
Can you buy another option that can supplement your internet connection, calls and can be paid for by several people?
If you buy a cell phone will you really improve your quality of life or will it get worse? For example, are you now addicted to watching content or social networks or are you going to be more stressed every month thinking about how to pay for this new expense?
Finally, is this new consumption really a priority for you?



Moment 1: Why do I need a cell phone?
Just like a car, the cell phone we choose should fit our main needs. It doesn’t make much sense to buy a 4x4 truck if you are going to be driving around a city with paved roads.
Now, think about what will be the most important activities and in which you will invest more time in your cell phone: do you want to take a lot of pictures of your region? then you should pay attention to the characteristics of the camera; are you going to be outside the house in the middle of the countryside all day, or are you going to use your phone as a modem to share your internet with other people participating in a SOLE? A good battery would be essential; do you want to use the internet to learn in a group? a big screen with good definition is important; do you want to play a video game with high definition? a good processor is a must; do you need to work with several applications at the same time? look at the RAM memory; do you need to have many applications and large files? look at the internal storage.
Now that you have decided whether to buy a cell phone, I will make an introduction taking my case as an example:


💡 At the beginning of 2024 I threw my cell phone away when I got out of a cab, because of my jobs and contact with my family and friends it is important for me to have a cell phone. Some time ago I decided that I will not invest more than 1'000,000 COP in this tool. About 5 years ago I met a new brand that was emerging, it had good prices and had very good references from friends and users on the internet, this brand is Xiaomi, my last two cell phones had been of this brand, each one was worth about 700,000 COP. However, I searched the internet for references and I saw that there is a new brand that is coming and is economical, Tecno, I looked at several references and saw that it is the best selling brand currently by free market, so I looked for a cell phone with similar characteristics to the previous ones, 250 Gb of internal memory, a decent processor, a battery of more than 4000 mA / h, a large screen and at least 8 Gb of RAM. These features are compatible with my work and personal use, I do not take professional photos, nor was I looking for it to play video games. Finally I found a cell phone of this brand for $ 475,000 COP, this cell phone I bought was a Tecno Spark 20 Dual Sim 256 Gb. So far I can say that it has been an excellent purchase!

Now it's your turn to identify what you need the phone for!



Moment 2: Set a budget
First of all, define what your budget will be, for this you can do the math of how many days of work you are willing to invest for this device. Do not get into debt for a cell phone, many times we are offered 1 or 2 year financing, and the cell phone is damaged or stolen before we finish paying for it.
  


Once you are clear about the above, you will know what features you should pay more attention to.


Camera
If you love taking pictures, here are some aspects that are central to detailing the camera of your device:
Resolution
This is what we commonly know as megapixels, although it is very important it is not all we should look at when evaluating a camera. The more megapixels it has, the more detail you will see in the images. However, you must have a limit. The standard might be a 12 MP camera, because if it has good features and excellent image processing, you will get great quality photos. If you start having higher resolution photos the files will be very heavy and will fill up the internal storage of your cell phone quickly.
Sensor and lenses
![lente.jpg](../../../../../Soluciona 1292bd68c5b681c6b5b5cec1700cc864/Solutions DB 1292bd68c5b681d1b87ccbb89a1b1d39/¿Cómo comprar un celular adecuado para mí 12a2bd68c5b6807f99afed36f9b83c06/lente.jpg)
Aperture
The lens aperture will be fundamental for a good photo, this characteristic defines how much light the camera can capture. It is identified by the letter f followed by a number, for example, f1.9 or f 2.0. The lower this number, the more light the camera will capture. Therefore, it is important that it is low, because with a higher light input, the images will have more detail.
  
A good cell phone camera must have a quality sensor, as well as several lenses. The latter, in fact, has already become a standard. When combined, they make it possible to obtain better images. One of the most popular lenses is the wide-angle lens. Thanks to this, much more information is incorporated into the photos and it provides a visual angle of up to 120 degrees, perfect for group photos or indoors where there is not much space.
  


Screen
A screen will define whether our eyes get tired more or less quickly, whether or not we will see a certain degree of detail or how quickly the battery will be consumed.
When you have clear that your cell phone must be a device to be used in a group, as it happens when we do SOLE, this feature becomes important, since it is not so easy for several people to read on a small screen.
Screen size
The size of cell phone screens has increased over time, although in recent years they have not grown much, since they lose their portability function in the pocket. We could say that most cell phones are between 3.5” and 6” (this measures the diagonal of this, ie from one upper corner to the opposite lower corner). It really depends on your taste, do you want a large screen that allows you to watch a video from a distance or do you prefer a small screen so that your cell phone does not attract so much attention?
![Tamaño pantalla.png](../../../../../Soluciona 1292bd68c5b681c6b5b5cec1700cc864/Solutions DB 1292bd68c5b681d1b87ccbb89a1b1d39/¿Cómo comprar un celular adecuado para mí 12a2bd68c5b6807f99afed36f9b83c06/Tamano_pantalla.png)
Screen technology
Full HD technology is more recent than HD and the number of pixels is higher compared to HD which works with 1,280 x 720 pixels. Full HD gives a much more realistic look to the image. The latter technology is only coming in the latest cell phones with large panels, as it does not make much sense to have high resolution on small screens.
Screen type
There are different types of screens, but in the current market two are the most popular: LCD technology, also known as inorganic, and OLED technology, known as organic.

LCD: These are backlit liquid crystal displays that usually cover the entire panel. In the past they were the most popular, but they are increasingly produced in smaller quantities. As they are backlit, they will consume more energy, but for this reason they look good in direct sunlight.
OLED: These screens differ from LCDs because their materials allow them to generate light by themselves when electricity is applied, this allows them to turn off or turn on each pixel independently, so they consume less energy. In addition, they end up being brighter and have better black color definition.

  


Internal storage
The internal storage defines the amount of files we can store on our cell phone, it is like the hard drive on a computer. This will determine how many programs you can have installed at a time, whether or not you can store all types of files. At this time we recommend buying a cell phone with at least 64 GB of internal memory. Also, see if you have the option to receive microSD cards to expand the capacity in the future.
  
.


RAM memory
  
This is the temporary memory of the cell phone, it helps in the performance and gives a clue of how fast the applications open and how fast the cell phone flows. We recommend a minimum of 4GB of RAM.


Processor
The processor is the brain, it is the one that is always awake and receives instructions. The more cores the processor has, the better performance it will have, although it will also depend on the brand. Here, the best option is to look at the name of the processor used by the cell phone that catches your attention and do a little research on your own. Hopefully it was not released more than 4 years ago.
  


Battery
  
It is one of the most important components of the cell phone, since it will condition its use. Autonomy, charging time and battery life are parameters that will affect us. Its capacity is indicated by the number of milliamps per hour (mAh) it can provide to an electronic circuit. Thus, a capacity of 3,000 mAh indicates that the battery is capable of delivering a current of 3,000 mAh for one hour before it is exhausted. We recommend that with the current consumption of a cell phone the minimum capacity is 4000 mA/h.


Compare it with another cell phone
Once you have some interesting options it is important that you compare them, for this you do not have to do it manually, there are several pages that already do this automatically. Here are some of them:
versus.com/es
www.movilcelular.es/comparar/moviles/
Here we compare my cell phone against a Motorola:
  


In addition to the Tecno Spark 20 comes out better qualified in its characteristics, we can see that in the Colombian market they have the following prices:

Motorola Edge 30 Neo Dual SIM Dual SIM 128 GB very peri 8 GB RAM - $ 849.900 COP
Tecno Spark 20 Dual SIM Dual SIM 256 GB Black 8 GB RAM - $ 499.000 COP

💡 We can have a better cell phone saving $ 350.000 COP by taking the risk to try an emerging brand.
Don’t be fooled
It is important that you constantly check emerging brands, usually there are brands with little advertising, very good features and a low price. However, many times out of habit and experience we continue to buy the same brand as the last cell phone. For example, my best friend has been using the Motorola brand since college, I think that although it is a good brand, it has very high costs, and I prefer new cheaper brands that have good references to save some money.
Another important element has to do with the warranty, when you live in a central city is easy if something happens with the cell phone there is a branch of all brands available in case you have to use the warranty, but in less central cities, for example Bucaramanga, the brand of my current cell phone “Tecno” has no office so if you live there you would have to send the phone to Bogota, pay more money and wait longer to get it back, but possibly in this city if there is a center of attention of more popular brands such as Motorola.

How much is enough?
This question is difficult to answer, but I think we can rephrase it as follows: Does the option you chose meet the need and intention you projected at the beginning? In the previous example I showed you how I consider that the cell phone I currently have was a very good choice for my lifestyle. This type of reasoning is what we want you to do when making a decision about the option you are going to buy.

Contenido
Buying a cell phone plan that fits your capabilities and needs

Welcome
Hi, I’m Nicolas and, like you, I’ve been progressively learning how to improve my connectivity.
I’m not an expert on the subject, but through internet searches, tutorials and, above all, trial and error, I’ve learned a lot and have put together functional solutions.
What is buying the right cellular plan for you?
Below, you will find a series of information, criteria and tips that try to be as clear as possible, so you can feel accompanied in making a decision on what cell phone plan to buy.
The estimated reading time is about 9 minutes and consists of 10 items, but, do not panic, you can read these items with the help of others. Remember that in SOLE Voltage we want to promote the collective use of the Internet.
What is it for?
In this solution, you will find a few practical tips to help you make a much more informed decision about which cell phone plans are right for you.
Before we start, some ethical issues
At SOLE Voltage, we want to clarify the ethical implication of the decisions we make, and we like to put the focus on the circumstance that leads you to make that decision. We often use uncomfortable questions to challenge ourselves.
Shall we play? You want to buy a cell phone plan with data, do you really need it? Think about it, it may not be the best option for you.
Sometimes free internet is available at public libraries. Maybe you can use a neighbor’s WiFi network, or you can buy a cell phone PIN to access the Internet for a few hours.
If, after doing a sweep of your options, you definitely think you need to buy a cell phone plan, this is the right place for you! Here is some advice on what prepaid and postpaid internet plans may be relevant.
What do you need?


Save money for the purchase
Information on available operators
A site where you can recharge or subscribe to the plan
Curiosity

How to do it?



Before we start: ALERT! prepaid or postpaid?
In order to have clarity when reading this solution, first, we must address some concepts. In this case, the difference between a postpaid and a prepaid plan.

























PrepaidPostpaidIt is when the user pays for mobile services before using them.This is when the user pays for mobile services after using them.You can recharge whenever you want.Month to month you will have to pay your bill.You can purchase your prepaid plan by subscription or on demand.Promotes your credit life.You don’t get a monthly bill.Gives you additional benefits such as lower rates
There is no absolute answer on the type of service to choose. It depends on the habits, possibilities and needs of each person.


Moment 0: How do I know if I need to buy a cell phone plan?
One of the characteristics of our current times is the great development of international and national markets. Our cell phones are made in China and we can buy them in Colombia, we can go to the market and buy rice brought from Brazil. In addition, we find disproportionate consumption options, we can buy white rice, yellow rice, bulk rice, lemon-flavored rice, etc.
There are endless options to turn us into consumers of products that, many times, we do not need. Thus, we end up buying non-nutritious foods and fall back on expenses that do not satisfy the main function of food.
In the same way, we fill our homes with an endless amount of merchandise that ends up piled up or discarded because, in the end, they are of no use to us.
At SOLE Colombia, we want to promote responsible consumption.
Is the choice of your cell phone plan with data a responsible choice? We encourage you to answer the following questions:

Do you need to buy a cellular plan or do you have other options to access the internet?
Is there another option to supplement your Internet connection that can be paid for by several people?
If you buy a cellular plan, will you really improve your quality of life or will it get worse? how much time will you be connected to social networks? will it be difficult for you to disconnect from content? will it involve a dose of monthly stress to know how you will pay for this new expense?
Finally, is this new consumption really a priority for you? what will you actually use it for?
Don’t forget this consideration: the decision you make may be reversible when conditions change. It’s not a child, it’s just a payment plan that you can change as and when you need to.



Moment 1: Why do I need a cellular plan?
Now that you’ve decided, it’s time to understand what you need it for.
Do you need the plan to facilitate your work, to study, to stay connected with your family and friends, to spend leisure time? Depending on your answer you will identify usage patterns.
Let’s use my case as an example:


💡 In 2022 I had two jobs and no office. In addition, I was very mobile: I traveled around Bogota and to different parts of the country on a recurring basis. I needed to connect to virtual meetings, one of my jobs required Zoom video calls. So I needed a data connection and to make calls to many people. At that time, I decided to get a postpaid plan with 10 Gb and unlimited minutes. Soon after, I started to travel and stay constantly at a family farm, where the data signal was very bad. I decided to buy a fixed internet plan for the farm. In 2023 I only had one job and I had an office with internet. I no longer needed to travel as much. I changed my postpaid plan to a cheaper one, and cancelled the internet plan at the farm.
Now it's your turn to identify what you need the internet plan for!



Moment 2: According to what you need, these are the questions to ask yourself

Do you need minutes, data or both?
Do you need a high connection speed to download large files or have video calls?
Do you constantly need to have this service or is it only for a few days of the week?
Do you need coverage in multiple territories or just one?
What budget do you have available for this expense?



Momento 3: De acuerdo con lo que está disponible, estas son las preguntas para hacerte
¡Ahora vamos a la acción! necesitamos conseguir la siguiente información:
¿Qué operadores móviles están disponibles en mi territorio?

Pregúntale a tus vecinos ¿qué operador usan o han usado en el pasado? ¿cuál funciona mejor? ¿cuál tiene mejor asistencia técnica? ¿cuál tiene mejores tarifas?
Puedes ir a las tiendas de telefonía celular en el centro urbano más cercano y preguntar directamente sobre que operadores tienen disponibles. En Colombia para 2024 hay múltiples opciones: Claro, Movistar, TIGO, WOM, Virgin Mobile, Avantel y Móvil Éxito son los principales operadores del mercado. Estos dos últimos son operadores pequeños que alquilan las infraestructura de los grandes operadores para prestar sus servicios.

¿Qué planes tienen disponibles estos operadores?
Luego de tener claro los operadores disponibles en tu territorio y saber cuales son los de mejor desempeño, procede a preguntar sobre los planes prepago y pospago que ofrecen. A continuación te presentamos unas tablas comparativas de los planes prepago pospago que ofrecían para 2023.
[Tarifas planes prepago 7-10 días](How to buy a suitable cellular plan for me 2602bd68c5b68155adf0fa3ef2a6025e/Tarifas planes prepago 7-10 días 2602bd68c5b6816cb8e1c0f2c893b571.csv)
Selectra, ¿Cuál es el mejor plan prepago celular en Colombia?
  


Moment 4: Evaluate which is the best option: What do I really need?
It’s time to make a decision! With the information you gathered, we will give you some criteria that we consider fundamental when making a decision:


Frequency of use, how often will you use it?

Pixabay License, pixabay.com/photos/iphone-smartphone-apps-apple-inc-410324/
If, for example, most of your days you need to make calls and be connected to the Internet, on balance, postpaid plans end up being the best option.
But if, on the other hand, your demand is occasional, has variability throughout the month and/or you may be constantly connected to a WiFi network at your workplace or home, then sporadic prepaid recharges may be the most useful.


Budget, how much money do you want to spend?
Now it’s time to set a budget! An easy count: how many hours of work per week does this new consumption represent? This may become a permanent expense, so it is important to reason the purchase.
The final decision may come down to this point: people who use prepaid plans usually do not have a constant flow of money to ensure they pay a monthly fee. While the use of postpaid is associated with people who can guarantee the payment of a monthly fee on a constant basis.
Currently, prepaid recharges, in the Colombian market, start at 2,000 COP with one day of validity.** On the other hand, the cheapest postpaid plans are around **27,000 COP per month**.**
To make this decision make a count of how much you are willing to invest in this service and what is your frequency of use.


Usage habits, for what and how are you going to use it?
Are you a person who makes long calls or do you spend most of your time connected to the Internet? Depending on this, you can prioritize the number of minutes, the number of Gigabytes or both, when choosing your consumption option.
Below, we explain each of these variables if you are still not sure how they work:

















MinutesDataThe minutes associated to your plan determine how much time you can spend talking to other cell phones nationwide, in some cases it also includes a number of minutes to other countries such as Venezuela, Canada or the United States. Currently, most postpaid plans come with unlimited minutes.These are the amount of mobile data destined for internet use on your phone. Its use is the amount that your cell phone uploads or downloads when you use it. You can configure them to not spend them, save them or restrict what they are used for. Remember that depending on the content you upload or download, the data consumption will be higher or lower, for example, watching a two-hour movie from your cell phone can consume approximately 300 MB, almost a third of a Gigabyte. Content such as videos, audios or high resolution images have a high data consumption compared to other types of files such as texts.

CC0 Public Domain,pxhere.com/en/photo/645095
For example, when we do SOLE, we need to connect a few computers in order to do research on Big Questions.
That means that, the plan we hire, must necessarily have data.
You can make your phone’s Internet connection available to the group, so that everyone can use it.
Although Internet searches that take place on a SOLE do not use a lot of data, they may want to watch videos or other content that requires more data than you have contracted. However, you don’t need that much data available all the time.
So you can buy a prepaid plan that allows them to stay connected, on time for the SOLE, and solve their Big Questions.
If you decide to see each other once a week or you want to have the space available with the connection at any time, you can consider paying for a postpaid plan between all of you? How does that sound?


Signal, where are you going to use it?
We have to look at coverage, upload and download speed, 3G, 4G signal.
Although we often hear people say that one operator is better than another, this will depend on the region and can change over time.
Sometimes they install more antennas or their networks become saturated due to an excess of users.


Other benefits, information that may be useful
Beware of “Free data usage in applications”.
Remember, nothing is free! Most plans currently in Colombia have the use of applications such as Facebook or WhatsApp in an “unlimited” way for the duration of the charge or for the entire month in case of postpaid plans.
They never explain to us that this unlimited consumption is only related to messages containing texts, that is, if you see a photo or a video, by Whatsapp or Facebook, the data associated with this consumption will be deducted from your plan.
Free’ applications
Some postpaid plans offer us license of applications such as Amazon Prime (series and movies platform) or Spotify (music playback application), i.e. for the payment of a cellular plan they give you access to the Premium version of these platforms. This can be beneficial if they are platforms that you already use, if not, ignore it, it will be just another consumption.
They also do not tell you that this way of ‘forcing’ you to use certain applications to communicate, entertain you, inform you or create your digital presence, is part of a commercial strategy. That is, companies will use the information from your profiles to offer you consumer goods, which will benefit the corporations responsible for their processing… in other words, these companies are profiting from the information they obtain about you. So, be careful, when a product is free, it is because you are the product.




Don’t be fooled
It is important that you constantly check the operators’ plans and offers.
Currently, in Colombia, you can do “portability”, that is, switch from one operator to another, change from one operator’s plan to another while keeping your number, just by requesting the new operator to do this process**. There are no longer any permanence clauses that oblige you to stay with the same operator for a certain period of time**. So if you see that there is a better option for you ****do not hesitate to port!
There is a small offer available in small operators, these are prepaid plans with long terms.
I, who live in Bogota, am evaluating switching to Movil Exito. I currently have a postpaid plan with WOM where I pay 40,000 COP**, this entitles me to **60 Gb and unlimited minutes**, that's a lot! Initially, I switched to WOM because, by doing portability, they gave me the **first three months free, plus 20Gb** and **they charged me 35,000 COP. Now that I am in Bogota and work from home and office, I have internet available from these places. I was reviewing options while writing this solution and I saw that Móvil Éxito offers the following prepaid plans:

Al mes, mi consumo no supera los 5 Gb y hago, por mucho, 30 llamadas al mes. Por esta razón el primer plan me saldría a $13,000 COP, ¡Menos de la tercera parte de lo que pago ahora! Eso si, tengo que hacer el pago de todo el año de una sola vez, pero no estoy atado a ningún tipo de contrato.
Per month, my consumption does not exceed 5 Gb and I make, by far, 30 calls per month. For this reason, the first plan would cost me $13,000 COP, less than a third of what I pay now! Yes, I have to pay for the whole year at once, but I am not tied to any kind of contract.
How much is enough?
This question is difficult to answer, but I think we can rephrase it as follows: does the option you chose meet the need and intention you projected at the beginning?
In the previous example, I showed you how I consider that the plan I currently have is excessive and I found options that do meet my initial requirement, at a third of the price I currently pay.
This type of reasoning is what we would like you to have when making a decision about the option you are going to buy.

es/inspire/how-to-get-donated-equipment-.content:
How to get donated equipment?
Created: 30 de agosto de 2025 23:19
Autor: Mateo
Solucionas: Devices, People
Dificultad: Promedio
Cuesta: Gratis
Ayudantes: Nadie
Tardas: Horas
R-reactions: No
Descarga esta solución para usarla desconectado
Como_conseguir_equipos_donados_20250729.pdf
Download this solution to use it disconnected
How_to_get_donated_equipment_20250729.pdf
Content
Giving a second use to equipment that would otherwise be discarded.
Welcome
Hello, are you there? My name is Mateo and I will accompany you in the development of this solution. If you are reading, listening or watching this is because you are interested or curious about how to get donated equipment. If so, you are in the right place.
What is getting donated equipment?
Simply put, this solution is about reuse. It speaks of being consistent with the care of the world in which we live, it speaks of taking advantage of things that for others are obsolete, but that we can use, perhaps, much longer.
This solution serves to give a second chance to equipment that is no longer needed. Did you know that there are companies that want to change their equipment and donate the ones they have? This equipment is usually in good condition and your community could take advantage of it.
What is this solution for?
While this solution does not require money for the purchase of equipment, keep in mind that this solution can take weeks, even months, depending on the steps we will tell you about below. On the other hand, you have a better chance of receiving a donation if you demonstrate that the use of the equipment will be community-based and that its purpose is to improve people’s quality of life.
What do you need?

Persistence.
Patience.
Seek support from others. Teamwork increases your chances.

How to do it?
Let’s start!
This solution is composed of three steps in which we will tell you everything we know and have learned at Fundación SOLE Colombia about how to get donated equipment. All cases are different, so it is important that you are willing to adapt these steps depending on the difficulties you encounter along the way.


Step 1: Search for potential donors
  
Photo by veerasak Piyawatanakul: www.pexels.com/es-es/foto/mujer-con-portatil-negro-mientras-se-inclina-sobre-la-mesa-de-madera-marron-1143513/
Generally, equipment donors are companies with large financial capacity, payroll and infrastructure. Think of telephone or computer companies, universities, or find out about sponsors of social projects in your region. However, we suggest you start with small companies. For this you have two options:
Option 1. Direct search: you can search for companies or people who donate equipment through the internet, social networks, consulting with your contact networks or close circles.
For option 1, make a list of the companies and the ways you have to contact them, it can be through the people who manage the finances of the organization or those who manage the computer equipment, the important thing is to get a direct contact of the donor company with whom you can talk in person, send an email, a call or a letter. If you send them a letter or mail, make sure they will read it and, if they are not responsible for making the decision, make sure they will forward it to the person they need.
Option 2. Dissemination: you can write a message or announcement in social networks making it explicit that: 1. you need donated equipment in good condition; 2. you have a community project in which many people will benefit; 3. write the number where they can contact you; 4. make it clear who you are and make sure the message arouses empathy and trust. An example of a message could be:
“Hello everyone! My name is Amaranta and I am part of the XYZ FOUNDATION. Does anyone know of organizations that are donating computer equipment in good condition? We are looking for support to implement a project with older adults in rural areas of Colombia. Any information or contact would be of great help, thank you! My contact number is 123456789”
We suggest you do both options at the same time, this will broaden the possibilities you have to find a donor company.
Be courageous! At this point it is key that you are persistent. This does not have a magic formula, it is a matter of knocking on doors and opening paths. In any case, if you have read or listened this far, it is because you already have the will to do it and I admire that.


Moment 2: Find the donor company and identify the relationship model.
  
Photo by fauxels: www.pexels.com/es-es/foto/foto-de-personas-haciendo-apretones-de-manos-3184416/
Once you have sent the requests you just have to wait and insist continuously to receive a response. Don’t let the contact go cold, if more than a week goes by without a response, write again or go in person if possible. When you get an affirmative answer, be clear about the model in which you will receive the equipment: not all companies donate their equipment, some decide to give it away, so there are two types of models:
Option 1. Gift of equipment: you may find a company or person who gives away their equipment. Relatives may give away equipment. When you contact them, make sure that you will indeed receive the equipment in this way.
Option 2. Equipment donation: Now, for the case of companies that donate is a different model in which a second chance is given to equipment that are in good condition and that can be used by people and communities that need them. How does it work? Many companies have to make upgrades that require changing their equipment or need new technologies to carry out their work, so they decide to donate and thus can receive a tax deduction.  It is important to note that in order for this to be possible, donating companies need to receive a donation certificate. If you are not part of a foundation, you should find an ally that can make this certificate for you. Who and how is this certificate issued for companies that want to donate? To get an ally think of a non-profit entity that has an active legal figure and can issue these certificates for the companies that will donate the equipment. For example, foundations, cooperatives or similar entities in your region. Talk to them and tell them about your purpose. If they decide to support you, ask them for guidance in this process.
We invite you to look up the story of Alex Cortés, an engineer who founded Click Foundation with the objective of giving a second life to computers that many people, organizations or companies no longer need; he decides to repair them, maintain them and give them away or donate them to those who need them most. If you want to know more about his story, we invite you to search about him, his foundation and his history.
Important: you must be clear about how the equipment will be used, since legally the equipment will belong to the ally you got. Don’t forget to check that the equipment you will receive is functional. We do not want you to end up storing technological garbage that you will have to repair.


Moment 3: Receiving the equipment and building a relationship
  
Photo by Ketut Subiyanto: www.pexels.com/es-es/foto/pareja-amor-relacion-casa-4246186/
  
Photo by Cytonn photography: www.pexels.com/es-es/foto/persona-que-firma-el-papel-955393/
For the reception of the equipment, in either mode, keep in mind that each company or person has its own procedure. The delivery of the equipment may be a shipment, you may have to pick it up or make an agreement about the place of delivery with the company or person who will make the donation. After the delivery, it is important to know what kind of relationship you want and can build with them:
Option 1. Equipment gift: for this option, no paperwork is usually needed to formalize receipt; however, those giving the equipment may want to build a short- to medium-term relationship, know how you will use the equipment and for what purpose. If not, make it explicit and maintain a good relationship with them. When equipment is given as a gift, paperwork is usually not necessary, however, from the SOLE Colombia Foundation, for example, we make a letter with thanks and signatures between the parties corroborating the delivery of equipment, its condition and the good use we will make of it.
Option 2. Equipment donation: For the delivery, make a donation request explaining your interests, conditions and the cooperation you will build. How much equipment do you need? What is the condition of the equipment you will receive? What does the donor company need from you? What will you use the equipment for? Who will be the people and communities that will benefit? For this option, we suggest that, as in option 1, you consider the possibility of building a relationship with the donor company. At the SOLE Colombia Foundation, we usually send the donor companies photographs that thank them and show evidence of the community use of the equipment, thus opening up the possibility of future donations.
5. What does the community use of the equipment imply?
Remember what we mentioned at the beginning of this solution about the possibilities of receiving a donation if you demonstrate that the use of the equipment will be communal? Now we invite you to reflect on the importance of the collective use of the equipment in a community. It is not only about receiving them, but also about reaching agreements on who will manage them, how they will use them and how often; this will imply fostering dialogue and teamwork. It is not about having a lot of equipment, but about knowing how to use it in community.
See you soon! We invite you to investigate other solutions and to keep on tinkering.
6. Recommended solutions
We invite you to read the solution on Team Governance.
7. Suggestions

If you want to know more, click here to read the press release made by El Tiempo newspaper in 2016.
www.gestionandote.org/donacion-de-computadores-para-desarrollo-de-proyectos-sociales/



How to know if this solution works?
When you receive equipment that others do not use, you have proven that this solution works. You will also have created a relationship with someone, that’s nice and powerful. Someone who has tuned into your purpose and wants to lend you a hand.
Why might this solution work?
Maybe this relationship is a long term one, can you imagine that every year they can donate a few computers to you, what would you do with all that equipment? Thinking about how you can extend that blanket to others is one way to make this world a fairer place. If you want to know what we at SOLE Colombia do with the computers that are donated to us, take a look at www.solecolombia.org

Content
Making a small antenna for my cell phone
Welcome
It’s a pleasure to greet you, my name is Mateo and I will accompany you in the development of this solution. If you are reading, listening or watching this is because you are interested or curious about how to improve the signal of your cell phone with a tin. If so, you are in the right place.
This solution can take you an estimated time of 30 to 40 minutes and has a basic level of difficulty.
What is this solution for?
This solution is used to temporarily improve the signal of your cell phone. However, the quality of this signal will depend on the weather or the conditions of the place where you are, your operator and the number of towers that emit radio waves around you so that you can make calls or surf the Internet, so the success of this solution will depend on other factors. However, this solution is a simple, fast and very interesting option to contribute to improve your cell phone signal. What we can tell you, for now, is that the results of this test will be exciting and revealing.
What do you need?

One person to work on this solution is enough. Cheer up.
A clean metal can, it can be a beverage can.
A scissors.
Scalpel (optional).
A ruler, preferably metallic.
A fine-tipped marker.
Thick transparent tape.
Safety gloves.

Before we get started, a few safety issues!
Although this solution has a basic level of difficulty, it is important that you keep in mind some recommendations for your safety:

Work on a flat, rigid surface, preferably a table that you can cut on.
Look for a clean can that is not rusty.
We recommend you to be in a quiet place, without distractions and to have as much time and patience as possible.
Keep your hands at a safe distance from the cuts you will make with the scissors or scalpel.
Preferably wear safety gloves.
We recommend you to be seated in a comfortable place to work.

How to do it?
This solution has 3 moments, but don’t worry, you are not alone, I will accompany you on this journey. Keep in mind that some steps can be frustrating and others very exciting, and that’s ok, it’s part of tinkering. The important thing is to keep trying.


Step 1: Draw a metal foil

Prepare all the materials mentioned above.
To perform this step we will need the can, the scissors and the scalpel. Place the beverage can on a flat and rigid surface, preferably on a table. Cut the can with the scissors or the scalpel in such a way that an open sheet is left, imagine that it is a rectangular sheet of paper. Remember to do this step with patience, cut the can on top of the flat surface you are working on and place your hand at a safe distance from the cut you are going to make.
Once you have cut the can like a rectangular sheet of paper, flatten it to eliminate as many irregularities as possible on the surface. Think of it as a smooth sheet of paper. This will be the metal sheet we will work with from now on.
With the ruler and the fine tip marker, draw a 4 cm by 4 cm square on the metal sheet. I care about your safety, so it is important to be careful with all the cuts you are going to make and remember to preferably wear safety gloves.

  
  
  
  


Step 2: Cut a 4 x 4 cm square.

Cut the 4 cm x 4 cm square with the scissors. With this you will have a square metal sheet.
Choose one of the sides of this square metal sheet and mark with a fine tip marker the center of the side you chose, that is, 2 centimeters.
Place the ruler in the center you previously marked and mark with the fine tip marker 0.5 cm on each side of that center. Repeat this same step on the opposite side of the side you are working on. Join the marks and draw the lines so that you have a 1 cm rectangle. How does it feel? If you finished step 7, we are on the right track. If not, we invite you to repeat the steps with patience. Here I will wait for you.
On each of the two drawn lines, draw marks every 0.5 cm. As a result you should have 7 marks on each of the lines.

  
  
  
  


Step 3: Install your antenna on the cell phone

Draw from side to side lines perpendicular to the marks you made in the previous step. Then, cut these lines drawn on each side without cutting the central column that has the width of 1 cm.
For this step you should have as a result 8 tabs cut on each side of the metal sheet. For each side bend the intermediate tabs: the second, the fourth, the sixth and the eighth. Now cut each of the remaining bent tabs. If you’ve reached this step, you should have a piece of metal with 4 tabs on two sides.
Almost there! We are very close to finishing. For this step you should line your metal piece on both sides with thick transparent tape, this will allow you to protect it.
Finally, with transparent tape stick this metal piece on the back right side of your cell phone (where your cell phone antenna is usually located) and protect it, preferably, with the cover of the cell phone you are using. If you made it to this step, I send you all my congratulations and hope this journey has been challenging and exciting.

  
  
  
  


How to know if this solution works?

You can test this solution by checking the signal bars or dots on your cell phone, which are usually located in the upper left or right corner of your screen. These bars measure how strong a signal you are receiving. In theory, the more bars you have, the better signal you should be receiving.
Another option is to test the download speed on your cell phone. Depending on the device you have you can download an application to monitor this speed and see, in different conditions, if the download speed is indeed improving.
This solution can achieve a significant improvement in the signal reception of your cell phone in one or maximum two bars or points. Note that the signal may not improve in places where there has never been a signal.

Why would this solution work?
Keep in mind that there is your cellular signal with which you can make calls and send text messages; and the Wi-Fi signal with which you can connect to the internet. By placing the can on the back right side of your cell phone, these signals can be amplified because the can is placed on top of the antenna inside the cell phone; amplifying and redirecting the signal. The key is that you can test this can in different conditions and draw your own conclusions as to whether or not this solution is working.
Inspiration: more internet to get more people online
Boosting your cell phone signal can help you share the internet with people who need it. Internet in a group is safer and can help other people in their work, study or enjoy various leisure activities. We want you to be part of a new way of using the internet together. Thank you for reading this solution.
See you soon! We invite you to investigate other solutions and keep on hacking.
