Some tips to get the most out of your router
Welcome
Hi! I’m Manu, the SOLE Colombia accountant, and I’ve also been very frustrated about losing my Internet signal right in the middle of an important meeting or a SOLE.
What is improving your router signal?
Just when you need it the most, the connection disappears, has it happened to you? It has happened to me more than once. But don’t worry, because you’re about to learn how to improve your router ‘s signal so that it happens less often.
Plus, I’ll show you how to optimize your Router settings so you can surf faster by changing the DNS servers and adjusting the WiFi channel. This is not difficult and you can do it from home! So get ready, we’re going to get the most out of your network.
What is it for?
I’m going to walk you through how to get the most out of your router. Together, we will improve the distribution of the WiFi signal in your space, achieving a more stable connection, so it won’t drop out when you need it most, whether it’s for a meeting, a class, or a SOLE session. No more interrupted signals when you’re researching a Big Question!
Remember that these settings will not increase your contracted speed, but they will help you get a better signal to every corner of your home by optimizing the DNS.
What do you need?

Use an Internet service that connects through a Router.
The Router’s access keys.
A computer connected to the network.
A little patience (hopefully not too much!).
Cacharrera attitude**.**

How to do it?
Now I am going to take you step by step to improve your WiFi signal. Trust me, something will have to change!


Step 1: Measure your connection speed
The first thing to do is to measure the speed of your current connection. This will allow you to compare the “before” and “after” adjustments. Download the Fast application or use the speed meter of your choice, and perform tests from various points in your home.
  
Screenshot, taken by Manuela Córdoba, (2024).
  
Screenshot, taken by Manuela Córdoba, (2024).
  
Photo taken from Pexels, (2024).
Ready? Perfect! Now you have a clear reference to notice the improvements.


Moment 2: Explore your space and locate the Router
It may seem obvious, but we often forget the simplest thing: get close to the Router. If you are organizing a SOLE session or have several devices connected, make sure they are as close as possible to get the strongest signal.
Where you place the router is key. Be sure to place it in an elevated spot, such as on a table, or even on the ceiling. Ideally, it should be in a central location, not in a corner or near a window, where it is often left by installers. Moving the router to a more strategic place will allow the signal to be distributed more evenly throughout the house.
  
Photo taken from Pexels, (2024).
  
Photo taken by Manuela Córdoba, (2024).


Moment 3: Place the Router antennas in perpendicular position.
Have you already seen the antennas of your router? Check them right now. An important detail to improve the signal is to make sure they are in perpendicular position, that is, pointing towards the ceiling. This helps the signal waves to be better distributed.
  
  
Make that adjustment and you will notice the difference. Well done!


With these 3 actions you should already see some improvement. If you want to go further, deploy the last more advanced steps:


Moment 4: Configure the DNS
What’s that?
DNS is like an address book that helps your computer find websites faster. By using faster DNS servers, such as Google’s or Cloudflare’s, you ensure that pages load faster. Your Internet provider’s default servers are not always the most optimal, so switching to more efficient ones can improve your browsing experience.
Now let’s do something interesting: configure the DNS. This will help the web pages you visit load faster, since DNS are the directories of IP addresses that the Router queries when browsing.
If you want to change to faster and more reliable DNS servers you will make your Internet queries faster. To achieve this, follow these steps:

Access the administration interface of your Router. To do this, in the network settings of your computer, look for the gateway. There you will find an IP address, something like 192.168.0.1 or 192.168.1.1.
Log in with the credentials, which are usually admin/admin, or check your device’s manual for the default passwords.
Change the values to 1.1.1.1.1, 1.0.0.1 (from Cloudflare) and 8.8.8.8.8 (from Google).
Open your browser and enter that address in the address bar. This will take you to the Router control panel.
Find the Network Settings section and, there, the DNS Servers option.
Save the changes and restart the Router.

Great! Now your network will use these DNS servers, which are faster and more reliable.


Step 5: Configure the WiFi channel
Another key setting is the WiFi channel configuration. Channels determine the frequency on which the Router broadcasts the signal. To avoid interference with other nearby networks, set your Router to the recommended channels: 1, 6 or 11:

Enter your Router’s configuration interface again.
Look for the Wireless section.
Choose one of the recommended channels: 1, 6 or 11.
Save the changes and restart the Router.

With this setting, you will reduce interference and improve signal quality. Okay, we’re almost done!


How do you know if this solution works?
Did you succeed? I’m sure it did! By following these steps I am sure that the Router signal will have improved and therefore, the WiFi distribution in your space.
Why should I
Although you won’t be able to increase the speed beyond what you have contracted :c, you will have ensured that every corner of your home receives a stronger and more stable signal.
I hope you find these tips helpful and that you no longer have Internet outages in the middle of an important meeting or exciting research at SOLE.

Welcome
[Audio_¿Cómo instalar una antena 3:4G?_Parte 1.mp3](../../../../../Soluciona 1292bd68c5b681c6b5b5cec1700cc864/Solutions DB 1292bd68c5b681d1b87ccbb89a1b1d39/¿Cómo instalar mi antena 3 4G 12a2bd68c5b680b08c63c0594aca7b30/Audio_Como_instalar_una_antena_34G_Parte_1.mp3)
Hi, I’m Sanjay, and I’m not an expert on connectivity issues, but I’ve learned by tinkering: by trial and error, and also by asking other people about it.
In this solution, you will be able to install a 3/4G antenna that you have purchased. If you have not bought them yet, you can go to the solution How to buy a 3/4G? antenna to do that first.
This solution can take from 30 minutes to a few hours, depending on the difficulty in locating the right signal for your antenna. It has a medium level of difficulty. It is to be done by 3 people, ideally: one, to read, the other two, to connect and hold the antenna components.
WARNING! It is important to know that there are many types of 3G or 4G antennas, although, in general, what we tell you in this solution should help you to be able to install the one you have.
Your antenna may come with a manual or instruction manual. It is always best to read it first. If it doesn’t, or the person who sold you the antenna didn’t explain how to do it, the following may help you as a reference.
Remember, the content of the instructions and what you find here may look a little different.
What is it for?
There are places where the cell phone signal is very weak, you can see it in the connection bars of your cell phone. For example, you see a single bar or something that says H+, E or even that there is no signal. An antenna, which has the necessary characteristics for the conditions of the place from where you want to connect, can help you to get a better connection quality.
I recently understood that the Internet signal that reaches cell phones travels through invisible electromagnetic waves, and that cell phones have a small antenna inside them that captures those waves, allowing us to have access to the Internet.
What the antenna does, simply, is to capture and amplify the specific data signal of the cell phone (3G or 4G): the signal travels, in electromagnetic waves, through the air, from a higher place than the one you are in -above trees, buildings or hills- and goes down, through a cable, to your height. Once at that point, the signal can be shared by generating a WiFi network, or by cable, using a modem or router. I know these terms may seem confusing, but as you go through the installation steps, I hope you will be able to understand them more clearly.
Before we begin, a few safety issues
Remember that you are working with electrical equipment. Be careful when connecting electrical power. Be aware of weather conditions, especially the risk of thunderstorms: the antenna, when installed, would act as a lightning rod. A lightning strike on the antenna could cause serious personal and material damage.

What do you need?


Your purchased4G antenna
Antenna coaxial cable
Modem with its respective power cable, Ethernet cable and Quick Start Guide
SIM card of the cellular operator with the best signal in the area
Computer with Ethernet and/or WiFi  connection or Smartphone (Android / IOS)
Tall rod (of the same length as the cable or a little less): it can be a metal, wood or guadua tube. The important thing is that it is as straight as possible and resistant.
Antenna supports
Wrench to tighten nuts.
Materials and tools to fix the rod (depending on where you install it).






How to do it?
This solution has 6 steps, some easier than others, but don’t worry, if I could do it, you can too. So… let’s get started!


Step 1: Define the place where both the Antenna and the modem will be installed.
Before unpacking your purchase, define where you want, or want, the modem and antenna to stay permanently. If it is in your home, it can be in the living room. If it is in a community space, it can be in a room that is secure and within easy reach of everyone who may use it.
The antenna should be securely attached to the pole. The rod must be able to be secured securely, in some way, outside the home or space.  We will explain how later.
The modem needs electricity, so identify the power outlet to which you are going to connect it.
Finally, consider where you are going to feed the antenna cable into the space where you will be leaving the modem. You may have to drill a hole in the wall, so that you don’t have to leave a window open. For now, you don’t need to do this until you have checked where the antenna works and connects best.
  
  


Step 2: Identify the cell towers in the area.
For antennas to work, generally, they must be able to see each other, or at least they should point to the same place.
If you live in a region with a lot of mountains it will be a bit more difficult to get a good signal, as opposed to a flat place.
In general, we can say that if there are mountains around you, your antenna will need more height.
****The next step is to look for the nearest cell tower: look for tall towers with antennas. They are usually located on the tops of the highest mountains to allow for greater coverage. It is important that you can locate it, because when you have your antenna in your hands, you will need to position it facing that cell tower.
  
If you don’t know where the nearest cell tower is, you can also ask your neighbors.
  
Taken from Wikimedia Commons


💡 You have now established the locations of the main elements of your solution:
- where to install your antenna,
- where it should point, i.e. the tower,
- and where you will put the modem that will generate the wifi signal to connect computers or cell phones.

You're doing great! Now comes the easy part: assembling the antenna.




Step 3: Insert the SIM card and connect the power to the modem.
Open the modem box. It should have its power cord, an Ethernet cable which is for connecting a computer and a quick start guide. Read the guide carefully. The following steps I describe match those steps but are a more detailed explanation.
Inserting the SIM can be complex. I had to make several attempts until I succeeded. You must be careful that the metal part of the SIM chip matches with some metal contacts on the modem. But fear not, let’s take it step by step and I’ll walk you through it.
  
Identify the SIM card size that matches the modem tray.
First, open the place on the modem where the SIM should be inserted. It is usually on the back of the modem. Identify the card size to be inserted. The modem’s guide will tell you. The model I have uses the Mini SIM size.
.jpeg)
Insert the SIM card into the trayYou will notice that both the SIM tray and the SIM card have a cut or beveled corner. That tells you the position where you should insert the card.
Carefully insert it into the tray and cover it.
Then connect ****the power cable to the modem and then to the power outlet. Turn on the modem as instructed in the guide. This can be automatic or on a power button.
.jpeg)
.jpeg)
Check to see if the modem is connected to the Internet.
On the front of the modem you will find the different connection indicators. The guide tells you what each one means. On the model shown here, the first indicator from left to right is whether it is on or off. The second, if it is red, means it has no signal. If it is blue or green it means it is connected (in this case it is connected). The third says it is broadcasting a wireless or wifi signal in space. The fourth indicates if an ethernet cable is connected (in this case not). The fifth indicator tells about the signal strength - like the bars on the cell phone (in this case it is very good).
.jpeg)
That’s it! You have the modem ready and functional, you are half way through the solution. However, it is possible that the signal indicator, the second one, is red. In that case, simply turn off the modem and let’s connect the antenna to it.


Step 4: Connect all antenna elements and raise the antenna
Now it is time to assemble your antenna. I recommend you start by removing the antenna elements.
Adjust the antenna to the highest end of the rod.
Start by adjusting the antenna support to the base of the antenna using the screws provided. Tighten the screws carefully making sure it is snug.
Then adjust the antenna brackets to the higher end of the rod. Remember that the rod should be a little shorter than the length of the cable you have. The brackets have a piece to “wrap” the rod in such a way that when tightening the nuts it clamps the rod as in the picture.
  
.jpeg)
.jpeg)
Extend the cable and connect the end that goes to the antenna cable. Uncoiling the cable and extending it to its maximum length helps make it easier to handle. Find the connector that matches the antenna connector and connect them.
.jpeg)
  
Find the connector from the modem to the cable and connect.
On this modem model there is a cover on the back of the modem that you must remove with a little force (keep the cover in the modem box). There you will find the place to connect the cable. Tighten the connector thread to the maximum carefully.
.jpeg)
  
Now you can raise the antenna with the help of another person and point it towards the cell tower you identified in the second step. Then turn on the modem and you are done. You have only two steps left to finish. Bravo!


Step 5: Connect the computer/cell phone to the modem
It’s time to turn on your computer’s or cell phone’s wifi and search for the modem’s network. Usually you will find the network name on a sticker on the bottom of the modem. There you will also find the password to connect, you are now ready to surf the Internet!
If your computer has an Ethernet input, you can also connect directly through the cable. Connecting via cable will always give you the best possible Internet browsing speed.
.jpeg)
Now, all you need to do is the last step, attach the antenna.


If you are not connected to the Internet, follow the recommendations below.
[20240312_Audio_¿Cómo instalar una antena 3:4G?_Parte 2.mp3](../../../../../Soluciona 1292bd68c5b681c6b5b5cec1700cc864/Solutions DB 1292bd68c5b681d1b87ccbb89a1b1d39/¿Cómo instalar mi antena 3 4G 12a2bd68c5b680b08c63c0594aca7b30/20240312_Audio_Como_instalar_una_antena_34G_Parte_2.mp3)
Sometimes we find ourselves in places far away from cell phone towers or with a lot of interference between the tower and our antenna. Here are some possibilities to try.
Go to the modem administration web page and try pointing the antenna in other directions.
Log in through a browser on your device (it can be Firefox, Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge or Explorer) to the IP address of your modem. This is usually found on the same sticker underneath the modem. The IP of this modem is 192.168.8.1.
.jpeg)
When you enter that IP address you will see the modem login page that will ask you for the password that is also on the sticker. Usually, the password is lowercase admin .
  
It will ask you a few questions to configure your modem preferences. Read carefully and select what you think is best for you. Finally you will get to the modem’s home page where it indicates the quality and speed of the connection.
  
If you see the green blips, it means that everything is well connected. On the other hand, if you see a red exclamation mark and an “X” in the internet bars it indicates that there is no connection.
  
This is where you should start rotating the antenna looking to point it in a better direction to get a better connection to the cell phone tower. Do this slowly and in small intervals. You can also change it to point more up or down using the different holes in the antenna support to the rod.
.png)
Each time you change the position of your antenna, wait a few seconds to see if the indicators on the screen or device change. If the internet bars and the green tick appear, you have succeeded in getting a signal! Congratulations! You are now ready to surf the Internet.
.jpeg)




💡 How is internet usage measured? Internet data usage is measured by the amount of data that is downloaded to your computer or cell phone when you make a query, for example, watch a video, listen to a song, read an article in an online newspaper or receive a text message. The “weight” of each of these files is measured in bytes of information and the most common measurement when you buy a data plan is Gigabytes, Gb or Gigabytes. To give you a rough reference, 1 Giga or 1 Gigabyte (which is 1 million bytes) is equivalent to 30 minutes of video in high definition (HD) or 2 hours in low definition (SD); or 200 songs; or 4 hours of video calls; or 600 web pages; or 350,000 text messages. As you may have noticed, a video is the most “heavy” and a text message is the least “heavy”. That’s why phone operators sometimes “give” you free text messages but charge you to watch videos.
💡 How fast can you access information on the Internet? As well as knowing how much they “weigh” it is important to know how fast you can access the files you are consulting. This is measured in Megabytes per second or Mbps that are downloaded to your computer or cell phone. Having more than 5 Mbps of download allows you to watch a video without being cut off and have 4 other computers doing internet queries at the same time. Having between 1 and 5 Mbps allows you to make a video call although it may have interruptions. Having less than 1 Mbps allows you to only consult web pages with patience or send and receive text messages. If you want to play video games or watch movies online you probably need at least 25 Mbps download.
    It may be useful to**test**the download and upload *speed* of your signal to improve the quality of your connection. This tells you how fast you are downloading data from the internet. To do this, go to a browser and search for speed test. You will see several test options, here I show you the one for Google Chrome. 
    
    <img src="/assets\images\¿Cómo instalar mi antena 3 4G 12a2bd68c5b680b08c63c0594aca7b30\Prueba_de_velocidad_1-800w.webp" alt="Prueba de velocidad 1.png" srcset="/assets\images\¿Cómo instalar mi antena 3 4G 12a2bd68c5b680b08c63c0594aca7b30\Prueba_de_velocidad_1-400w.webp 400w, /assets\images\¿Cómo instalar mi antena 3 4G 12a2bd68c5b680b08c63c0594aca7b30\Prueba_de_velocidad_1-800w.webp 800w, /assets\images\¿Cómo instalar mi antena 3 4G 12a2bd68c5b680b08c63c0594aca7b30\Prueba_de_velocidad_1-1200w.webp 1200w" sizes="(max-width: 600px) 400px, (max-width: 1200px) 800px, 1200px" loading="lazy" />
    
    <img src="/assets\images\¿Cómo instalar mi antena 3 4G 12a2bd68c5b680b08c63c0594aca7b30\Prueba_de_velocidad_2-800w.webp" alt="Prueba de velocidad 2.png" srcset="/assets\images\¿Cómo instalar mi antena 3 4G 12a2bd68c5b680b08c63c0594aca7b30\Prueba_de_velocidad_2-400w.webp 400w, /assets\images\¿Cómo instalar mi antena 3 4G 12a2bd68c5b680b08c63c0594aca7b30\Prueba_de_velocidad_2-800w.webp 800w" sizes="(max-width: 600px) 400px, (max-width: 1200px) 800px, 1200px" loading="lazy" />
    
    This way you will know how fast you are downloading data and what kind of queries will work for you. 
    
    If you are connected to the internet, then enjoy it and learn all you want. 
    
    If not, keep testing both by looking at the modem's home page and by doing speed tests by rotating the antenna in small clockwise intervals until you get the fastest download speed. 
    
    If you test and the modem speed or indicators increase, keep turning the antenna a little more. If on the next one, the signal or download speed reduces then go back to the previous point and mark that point somehow as that is the best point of the connection. Then you can fix the antenna facing that direction on the last step. That was a long one, great that you made it! 
    
    - **If it still doesn't connect, here are some more recommendations**
        
        For accuracy, **test the signal strength** by rotating the antenna in different directions.
        
        Sometimes geographic conditions are more complex than we imagine. There we will have to determine if your antenna is indeed connected to the cell phone tower and with what quality. 
        
        To do this, go to the **Advanced** section in the modem menu and look for System and then Device Information. This is how it appears in my modem, but it should be similar in yours. 
        
        <img src="/assets\images\¿Cómo instalar mi antena 3 4G 12a2bd68c5b680b08c63c0594aca7b30\Ingreso_a_Avanzados__Sistema__Informacion_del_dispositivo-800w.webp" alt="Ingreso a Avanzados : Sistema : Informacion del dispositivo.png" srcset="/assets\images\¿Cómo instalar mi antena 3 4G 12a2bd68c5b680b08c63c0594aca7b30\Ingreso_a_Avanzados__Sistema__Informacion_del_dispositivo-400w.webp 400w, /assets\images\¿Cómo instalar mi antena 3 4G 12a2bd68c5b680b08c63c0594aca7b30\Ingreso_a_Avanzados__Sistema__Informacion_del_dispositivo-800w.webp 800w, /assets\images\¿Cómo instalar mi antena 3 4G 12a2bd68c5b680b08c63c0594aca7b30\Ingreso_a_Avanzados__Sistema__Informacion_del_dispositivo-1200w.webp 1200w" sizes="(max-width: 600px) 400px, (max-width: 1200px) 800px, 1200px" loading="lazy" />
        
        If you look in that list of information you will find several pieces of information. The 4 parameters you are looking for are RSRQ, which indicates signal quality; RSRP, which indicates signal strength; RSSI, which indicates signal strength; and SINR, which indicates the ratio of signal to noise being generated. Remember that these are electromagnetic waves traveling through the air. 
        
        <img src="/assets\images\¿Cómo instalar mi antena 3 4G 12a2bd68c5b680b08c63c0594aca7b30\RSRP-800w.webp" alt="RSRP.png" srcset="/assets\images\¿Cómo instalar mi antena 3 4G 12a2bd68c5b680b08c63c0594aca7b30\RSRP-400w.webp 400w, /assets\images\¿Cómo instalar mi antena 3 4G 12a2bd68c5b680b08c63c0594aca7b30\RSRP-800w.webp 800w, /assets\images\¿Cómo instalar mi antena 3 4G 12a2bd68c5b680b08c63c0594aca7b30\RSRP-1200w.webp 1200w" sizes="(max-width: 600px) 400px, (max-width: 1200px) 800px, 1200px" loading="lazy" />
        
        Below you can see a table that indicates the parameters of the cellular signal coverage that your antenna is receiving. Note that three of them are negative numbers and as they approach zero the signal improves. This information may seem a bit technical, but don't worry, you don't need to understand it in great depth for it to work. 
        
        [Parametros de señal 3/4G](How to install my 3 4G antenna 2602bd68c5b681debe19fc1064315e7c/Parametros de señal 3 4G 2602bd68c5b6812499d6e8a7b5061af6.csv)
        
        What you need to do, again, is to rotate the hoisted antenna in small intervals and wait a few seconds to notice how those numbers change. I mainly look at the RSRP which is the power of the connection. If you want you can draw a circle on the floor around the antenna rod and draw lines dividing the circle into equal pieces. Then you point the antenna in the direction of the line and check if the parameter got better or worse. If it got better keep turning and checking the parameter. If it got worse, go back to the previous point. 
        
        This is how to point the antenna more accurately. Good luck catching the signal! You have become a real internet tinkerer. I am very proud of you. 
        
        <img src="/assets\images\¿Cómo instalar mi antena 3 4G 12a2bd68c5b680b08c63c0594aca7b30\Rotar_la_antena-800w.webp" alt="Rotar la antena.png" srcset="/assets\images\¿Cómo instalar mi antena 3 4G 12a2bd68c5b680b08c63c0594aca7b30\Rotar_la_antena-400w.webp 400w, /assets\images\¿Cómo instalar mi antena 3 4G 12a2bd68c5b680b08c63c0594aca7b30\Rotar_la_antena-800w.webp 800w, /assets\images\¿Cómo instalar mi antena 3 4G 12a2bd68c5b680b08c63c0594aca7b30\Rotar_la_antena-1200w.webp 1200w" sizes="(max-width: 600px) 400px, (max-width: 1200px) 800px, 1200px" loading="lazy" />
        


💡 Be aware that weather affects: Since you are using an outdoor antenna, weather conditions may affect how fast or slow your connection is. For example, a very humid day can slow down your connection. Don’t worry, you will gradually improve your Internet experience together as you try new solutions.


Step 6: Fix the antenna
We have reached our last step. What a great job you have done.
Now, with the direction of the antenna clear you can leave your antenna permanently installed to a wall or a column or a tree; whatever location you determined in Step 1.
Tighten the antenna brackets to the pole and raise the antenna.
First, as you have already determined the direction, tighten the antenna brackets to the pole as tight as possible to ensure that they will not move in wind or rain or if a bird lands on them. If you have already tightened them securely it is not necessary to do this again.
.jpeg)
Anchor the rod to the wall or to the support you haveThen, use suitable brackets to anchor the rods to the base. If it is to a wall, drill and drill holes and screws to secure it. If it’s to a tree, tie it with wire.
.jpeg)
  
  


That’s it! With teamwork you have managed to install a 3/4G antenna to have a wifi signal in a fixed space. You’re now the official gadgeteer of your home or community.

What can you do?
Among many connectivity solutions I have tried, this is one of the best to create a space to access the Internet together, allowing several people to connect to a wifi signal at the same time in places where the 3 or 4G signal is weak. If there is no cell phone coverage, this solution will not work. However, telephony coverage is gradually increasing all over the planet.
I recommend it not only for the home, but for common spaces such as schools, libraries, businesses or community halls. It can also be used in public spaces such as parks if they have a place to leave it under insurance and with constant electricity.

How far can you go?
It is not an economical solution, but I have seen that it can have a great reach as long as it becomes a community internet access point. To do this, it is necessary for the community to agree to buy it with contributions from the members and maintain it together. This may be a considerable initial expense, but it is more economical over time than if each person buys his or her own data plan individually.
💡 In SOLE Colombia we have taken it to communities where it is installed in a community space where everyone can access it and decide how much, when and what it can be used for. In this way, the community regulates the data recharge according to its use and the data is used collectively to the maximum. For example, it is prioritized so that children can do homework or the community can watch a movie together, rather than using the data to access their individual social networks. But this is another challenge. The point is, you already have Internet access!
I invite you to think about how far you can go and to share it with other bangers!

Explore your cell phone WiFi connection passwords
Welcome
Hi, I’m Belen. I’m not an expert in technology and I’ve learned to use it as it has appeared. I don’t deny it, I like to read the instructions of the devices I buy and I make it a point to understand many of the updates that are installed on my cell phone… lots of nerda!
What’s it like to know your cell phone WiFi passwords?
I remember when you had to put in your modem password every time you connected to the Internet. If there’s one thing I appreciate about this new era of smartphones, it’s the time savings of not having to type in the WiFi password every time you connect. But where do you store them, and how do you share those keys or passwords with anyone? Read on.
What is it for?
With this solution you will be able to explore the WiFi passwords you already have stored in your cell phone. If you want to do SOLE in a place where you have been connected before, you can reconnect to the WiFi without having to re-enter all the characters of the password (which is sometimes a long string).
What do you need?

Cell phone with Android operating system.
Internet connection.
At least one WiFi password stored in your cell phone.
Curiosity.

How to do it?


Moment 1: Explore your passwords
First of all, access your phone’s “Settings”. Then, follow the “WiFi” section, where you will see all the available networks around you. Press the Internet network to which you already have access and for which you want to know the password. When you do so, a QR code will appear with this information. Then take a screenshot of this image.
  


Step 2: Cracking the password
The next step is to be able to use a reader that has permission to be able to read this information. We cannot use the QR reader of our own phone, so we can use one online at the following page: zxing.org
  
Once we are on this page, we upload our image and click on the “Submit Query” button. When we do this, the network name and password will appear so we can share it.
  


Moment 3: You can now share it!
Now, all that remains is to share this information with the people who need it. Who wants to make a SOLE? Now that you can share the password, all the teams can start their research and solve the Big Question they want!


How do you know if this solution works?
With this solution you will get to scan all the WiFi passwords you already have stored on your cell phone.
Why would this solution work?
You have the possibility to know the saved passwords, but not those you haven’t saved yet. To save them initially you have to ask the owner of the WiFi to share his password with you, but you will not have to ask for it again.

Find out how the internet reaches your device
Welcome
Hi, I’m Belen. I’m not an internet expert, in fact, I feel old and I don’t understand a lot of things about connectivity. If you also feel like me, this information will enlighten you. If you don’t feel like me, but you want to better understand the differences between signals and how they relate to the operation of the devices, this information will get you out of doubt.
What is it to know the type of signal you have on your device?
Internet signals can be classified in several ways, in SOLE Colombia we have chosen this classification, according to the means by which the signals are transmitted.
At the moment, the signals that exist are:

Cable signal, the fastest and most stable

Fiber optic: it uses pulsed light to transmit data through special cables. It is the fastest and most stable type of signal known.
Coaxial cable: transmits data through copper cables (also used for cable TV).
DSL (Digital Subscriber Line): uses telephone lines to transmit data. It is less fast, but uses a network that has existed for a long time, so it already reaches many places and does not require a new installation.


Wireless signal, which connects over the air and requires signal repeaters.

Wi-Fi (Wireless Fidelity): uses radio waves, in different standards, to broadcast the signal to the devices that make up your network.
Mobile network (3G/4G/5G): they use the infrastructure of mobile telephony signals to provide Internet access and move in a specific wave spectrum. The difference between them has to do with speed, 3G is the slowest and oldest, 5G the fastest and most recent. Some devices available on the market were not built to support 5G and it is not available in many parts of the world because the developments needed to detect the wave spectrum are not yet developed. As a tidbit, I tell you that 5G technology still generates mistrust regarding data security and the lack of spectrum regulation limits the developments needed to incorporate it worldwide 🫢


Satellite, which travels through space and requires a satellite dish.

GEO, or based on geostationary orbit satellites: they are far away from the Earth and provide greater stability, which makes them ideal for remote areas. You may be familiar with names like Viasat and HugesNet, which are providers of this technology.
LEO, or low earth orbit satellite-based: they are closer to the Earth, between 500 and 2000 km. They are faster compared to GEO, but require more devices to cover the same area. The names of the providers of this service may ring a bell: Starlink, OneWeb, Amazon Kuiper, and Telesat Lightspeed.
MEO, or medium orbit satellite-based: these are located between LEO and GEO and are the least common. The marketing of this type of connection has been aimed at sectors such as navigation (GPS) and high-end business services, so they are not as visible to the average end user.



Depending on the type of device you have, you will have access to different possible sources of Internet signal. Below you can see what type of signal each type of device allows:
Devices and signals:















































DeviceWiredWifiMobileSatelliteComputerSomeAllNoneNoneTabletNoneAllSomeNoneCellularNoneAllAllNoneSmart TVSomeAllNoneNoneIOT (Internet of Things)SomeAllNoneNone
What is it good for?
I sometimes get overwhelmed with error messages from electronic devices and get very frustrated when the device doesn’t respond to me! However, I have learned a lot. Among other things, that there are some Internet signals that work better than others, and also that some devices work better than others with different signals. I hope this information will help you to better understand connectivity and to better use your electronic devices.
What do you need?

Your device, on which you want to check the type of signal you have.
Curiosity

How to do it?
How do you know if you have a cable signal?
Having a cable internet service guarantees that you are getting 100% of the signal that your provider gives you. If you have an ethernet cable connected to your computer, you should have a wired signal.

What to do if your connection is not working?

Check the lights on the router: look for the ones that indicate the Ethernet connection (they are usually green/orange and blink when there is activity). If they are red or not lit, check the mains connection. You can reboot the router and start over, it almost always works.
Check the connection on the device: check the Ethernet connection status in your computer’s settings, it should confirm that you are connected.
Check the Ethernet cable: check if it is properly connected, on the router and on your device, and that it is in good condition.
If nothing works, contact your service provider.



How do you know if you have Wi-Fi signal?
Looking at the WiFi icon 🛜 is the quickest way to check your connection: the more bars that are colored, the better your signal. If the icon has a warning sign, it means there is a problem or it is not available. If the icon is disabled or has a line through it, it means it is turned off and you should turn it on.

What to do if your connection is not working?

Access the Wi-Fi settings: from your device’s settings, you can access the networks that are available. If one of them appears as “connected”, you are connected to that network. If you do not see “connected” to any of them, you may need to choose one and access it with a password, or the signal may be weak. You can try turning the router off and on again, and also the computer, it often works to reset all the information and start from scratch. It is also useful to put the device in ‘airplane mode’.
Check the signal strength: in the device’s settings you can check how strong the signal is for each available network. Moving closer to the router or removing obstacles between you can improve the signal.
If nothing works, contact your service provider, there may be an error in the configuration.



How do you know if you have a mobile signal?
Look in a top corner of your cell phone. There you will find some mobile signal bars 📶: if you see one or more bars, the phone is receiving signal and reading your SIM card. You can also confirm this in your phone’s settings and check the signal strength.

What to do if your connection is not working?

Check that your SIM card is properly installed: it is through the card that your mobile connection provider authorizes you to use their network. It has happened to me that I have put the SIM card upside down in my mobile device and there was no way to connect or call.
Activate mobile data: makesure that ‘mobile data’ is active, as well as ‘mobile networks’.
Check the signal strength: usually this information is under ‘mobile networks’ and ‘data usage’, or under ‘about phone’ and ‘signal strength’ and can be found on the device settings icon.
Check the network settings: you can check if there are any errors in the network settings, if you don’t understand much, you can call your service provider.
Check your signal provider’s coverage maps: you may be in an area where there is no coverage and you will have to configure one of the other Internet connection options.
If nothing works, contact your service provider, there may be an error in the configuration.



How do you know if you have satellite signal?
Installing the satellite signal implies that you have had to install a software package to be able to operate the connection with your satellite dish 📡 If your dish is properly installed and pointing towards the satellite, the weather is good and you have no clouds or storm on the way, the router turned on and a good visibility, you should be able to enjoy good connection.

What to do if the connection does not work?

Check the physical conditions of the satellite dish: it must be installed correctly, in a place with a clear view of the sky, with no obstacles such as buildings or trees around it.
Check the weather conditions: the presence of clouds or approaching thunderstorms can affect the satellite signal.
Check the orientation of the antenna towards the satellite: for this, you will need to check the elevation (vertical) and azimuth (horizontal) angles. For this you will need a compass and an antenna alignment application, as well as a signal meter. You can make progressive adjustments to fine-tune the signal reception.
Verify the router connection: check that it is turned on, the Ethernet cable is correctly connected to the satellite modem and the router and that the cable is in good condition.
Check the signal on your device: some satellite internet systems have signal monitoring software that can provide you with valuable data to know if it is connected correctly.
Test the speed: you can do aspeed check by consulting an Internet scientist.
If nothing works, contact your service provider, there may be an error in the configuration.



How do I know if this solution works?
I have learned a lot by completing this solution and I would love to know if, after reading and interacting with it, you feel the same way too.
I encourage you to keep on tinkering, and to do it with someone, which is always more enjoyable, fun, and loaded with new questions that can lead you to dig deeper into all these topics.
Why could this solution work?
Remember that the Internet belongs to everyone and for everyone, the more we know about it, the better we will know how to use it… I embrace you!

Welcome
Hi, I’m Belen. I didn’t write the whole of this solution, but, while reviewing it, I remembered many SOLE sessions that work thanks to this solution. Finding a place where they sell a few data, or minutes, of Internet connection via satellite has allowed us to take SOLE where we never thought we could go.
What is getting an Internet PIN?
Accessing the Internet from a satellite connection is a recommended method of connection in places where cable or telephony does not reach, such as rural or remote areas. In a city it constitutes an alternative and somewhat inexpensive system to the usual ones.
In Colombia, a “satellite connection pin” refers to a code or key that allows connection to internet services or communication through satellites. These codes may be needed to activate a satellite internet service, such as Starlink, or to configure satellite communication devices that are used in areas without terrestrial network coverage.
This solution is an explanation of how to access the satellite connection as a per-day or per-hour service, something we can pay for in advance.
What is it for?
If your intention is to use the Internet connection for something specific, this is the ideal solution. For example, if you want to convene your community to learn things together, using the internet as a group, that is, making a SOLE, having data to share to two or three computers and that everyone can ask the network for the things they want to learn, is the best way to guarantee the connection.
What do you need?

An internet operator in the area.
Money to pay the PIN.
A device to access the Internet.

How to do it?
Follow these steps to buy the PIN and connect to the Internet:


Step 1: Recognize if this service exists in your area.
First of all, it is necessary to know if this service is offered in your territory on a regular basis. This service exists in places where the mobile data network of conventional operators does not exist, because, if it did, it would be more viable to recharge your phone number with a data package, or to have a postpaid plan.
In some places, Internet operators sublease the satellite Internet connection in some places where the connection cannot reach by cable or they know that people in the area cannot contract other types of cell phone services. For example, this is a company that offers this type of service in Barranquilla: zonawipi.com/


Step 2: Evaluate other options
If you found that the service is in your living area, it is important to see if it is economically more convenient for you. That is, if you have to buy pins and travel to another place to connect every day, this option may not be the most viable. Perhaps another solution would be better, such as taking up a collection to pay for community internet.
If it is definitely the most viable option, buy it!


Moment 3: Buy the Pin and get online
Now that you have decided to buy a PIN, remember to make the most of it. The connection time will be restricted only to the places where this network has reach. In practice, it works like an Internet Café where you connect wirelessly with your own device.
You just have to follow the instructions on the paper where the purchased PIN comes. Normally you must connect to a WiFi network, which will automatically redirect you to a link where it will ask for the PIN number to give you access to the Internet. That’s it, now you can connect and enjoy!
Remember that you will get a lot out of your Internet connection if you share it with other people who cannot access this resource. A great way to learn and enjoy together is to do SOLE. SOLE is a methodology in which real life challenges can be solved through Big Questions, using the Internet. In your community, do you want to learn how to get the most out of your crops? Do you want to know what games children in other countries play? Do you have questions about how a particular weather phenomenon occurs or how to take advantage of changes in the weather? Do a SOLE! You can find more information at www.solecolombia.org/solea


How do you know this solution works?
With this solution you can have a temporary connection with internet access in a specific location.
Why would this solution work?
We have to measure very well the bandwidth offered by the service and, in general, the quality of the service used in relation to its cost. This solution is designed for non-recurrent access, since, in the case of recurring access, it would be very costly and it would end up being more economical to hire other types of services.

Managing lending for others










Sole Colombia
Welcome
Hello, I’m Sanjay. I’ve been doing SOLE for ten years and have brought SOLE Colombia to what it is today. For years, I’ve seen how many computers are available collecting dust in school closets, or with restricted use because the person assigned to their custody believes that strict criteria must be met.
What is sharing available computers and managing their lending?
With this solution, I want to focus on the importance of using the Internet in groups. It’s a very different experience: it’s shared use of devices, which opens the door for us to walk together along the paths of the Internet. You’ll have the opportunity to experience devices that we all use and care for, which are the gateway to living better together, using the Internet.
What is it for?
Sharing computers benefits everyone. We don’t need as much money to buy or maintain them because we can share the costs among more people, and more people can benefit from their use.
When we share computers and use them together, they become a safe place to learn and do things together: we take care of the spaces we enter, avoid dangerous portals or inappropriate content to protect others, better understand the information we review together, find common interests, interact with each other instead of just with machines… we turn technology into a park where everyone can play. SOLE is a perfect tool for sharing your computers with an interesting and common purpose: solving Big Questions. Want to know how? Go to www.solecolombia.org/solea and find out.
What do you need?

Computers to share.
Place with electricity.
Generosity.

How to do it?


Step 1: Managing computers
First, you need computers to share, which you can find in a public library or school. Normally there are government programs that provide these computers, and they often remain stored and unused due to lack of knowledge.
Once you identify the place, you must find the person in charge, who will be the key person for your success. Tell them about your purpose for using the computers, such as doing SOLE or any other purpose. Also, explain the difficulty or impossibility for your community to have access to their own computers. Then set a date and time when you will come with your community so that both parties are committed.
  
Foto: Sole Colombia


Step 2: Agree on rules for sharing
Once the place and computers are committed, gather your community and talk about the arrangements you’ve already made so they can see the prior work and share the responsibility with you. Then, discuss the minimum care they should take and ask if they can think of other types of care. Remember that this first time will be decisive for whether they will continue to lend you computers in the future.
  
Foto: Sole Colombia


Step 3: Let’s share!
Contact the library manager or public space and go with your group to enjoy using the internet together. Always remember to enjoy the devices in a shared way, for example, 4 people can sit at the same computer.


How do you know if this solution works?
This solution is a series of recommendations that give you a route to more easily manage computers in a public space to share with your community.
Why might this solution work?
This solution will not allow you to get computers permanently, and in places with little government presence, you may not find places where they will lend you these computers.

Restart and share your phone’s internet with others
Welcome
Hello! This solution was written by Nicolás, one of the SOLE Colombia tinkerers.
It is reviewed by me, Belén, and although I like to tinker, sometimes I find it hard to understand how things work. I guess I’m already a few years old and everything changes very fast… when I started using computers, or computers, they were basically typewriters. But not anymore… I encourage you to lose your fear!
What is setting up a personal WiFi zone?
Did you know that your smart phone has an almost permanent Internet connection? Usually with cell phone plans, a data plan is attached, which allows you to access the Internet.
That connection can become slow or inefficient and you have to restore it. But you might also want to share it with others, want to know how? Read on.
What is it for?
You may want to share the Internet signal of your data plan with other people. But you may also find that, even if you have an Internet connection, the pages you want to open load with difficulty, or the data call connection does not work well.
Almost always, the best way to get everything back up and running is to restart everything from scratch.
Once rebooted, you will be able to share your phone’s Internet signal to make SOLE with your community!
What do you need?

A cell phone.
Enough data on your cell phone to share with others.
Generosity.

How to do it?


Step 1: Restart your data connection.
Swipe down from the top of your phone to access the control panel. Once here, select the “Mobile data” option , turn it off for a few seconds and turn it back on. Wait a moment for the phone to access the cellular network and that’s it! Your connection will be fresh and working properly.
Want to know another trick? Activate the airplane mode, this will reset all your phone’s settings related to the Internet signal.
  


Moment 2: Set up the mobile hotspot
Go to settings and look for “mobile hotspot”, in English it appears as “Hotspot”.
In this menu look for the option “Set up a mobile hotspot”. You will see several data, for now we are only interested in configuring the name of the WiFi network you create and the access password.
Once you change them, click on the pimp (or the cross) to save the new configuration.
  


Step 3: Share internet
Slide the top of your phone down to access the control panel, you can find the option “Mobile hotspot”, “Hotspot”, or something similar.
Simply activate it to share the Internet signal with whomever you want.
If you want to do SOLE, this is an excellent solution to get all computers to perform their search. You know that in SOLE Colombia we are always thinking about how to take advantage of the resources that we have individually to take our communities to improve their Internet experience… there is nothing like using it as a group!
  


How to know if this solution works?
With this recipe you can reset your phone’s cellular network settings. This will improve browsing speed and connection stability. You will be able to share it with other phones and/or computers and search the Internet for answers to the Big Questions that motivate your SOLE.
Why would this solution work?
Restarting the cellular network connection will improve your connection and you will be able to surf a little faster, but the geographical area where you are must have coverage from your operator.
This recipe will not work if the phone signal in your area is not of good quality. Learning to share the Internet will be a very important step for the moment you get computers, since it is easier to use the Internet in a group with large screens.

Content
Check the real quality of your connection
Welcome to
Hi, I’m Belen. Until recently, I didn’t know that you could test the speed of your Internet connection. I found it very easy and very useful to learn how to do it because it allows me to know at every moment the state of my connection. Understanding why some things don’t work for me at certain times, reassures me and allows me to look for solutions.
What is an internet connection speed test?
An internet connection speed test, or speed test, is a tool that measures the speed of your internet connection, evaluating the download and upload speed, as well as the latency (ping).
What is it useful for?
These tests are useful to verify if the speed contracted with your provider matches the actual speed you receive. It also helps you identify connection problems and make informed decisions about your Internet service provider.
What do you need?

The device with which you are going to connect to the Internet.
Access a website, or download a measurement app, such as Speedtest.net, Fast.com, or nPerf.com. There are also mobile applications such as Speedtest by Ookla.

How to do it?


Step 1: Access to a speed test service
You can use websites such as Speedtest.net, Fast.com, or nPerf.com. There are also mobile applications such as Speedtest by Ookla.
  


Step 2: Run the test
Start the test on the website or app.
  


Step 3: Interpret the results
The results generally show the download speed, upload speed and latency (ping).

Download speed: This is the speed at which you can receive data from the Internet, such as downloading files or watching videos.
Upload speed: The speed at which you can send data to the Internet, such as sending emails or uploading videos to social networks.
Latency (ping): The time it takes for a signal to go back and forth between your device and a remote server, measured in milliseconds. A low ping is preferable, especially for online gaming or video calls.

  


Additional considerations:

**Wired vs. WiFiconnection:** Wired (Ethernet) speed tests are usually more accurate than WiFi tests, as WiFi connection can be affected by interference.
**Test servers:** Some services allow you to choose the test server for more accurate results or to test different locations.
Interpret the results: Compare the results with the speed contracted with your provider and consider factors such as time of day and activity on your network, as this may affect the results.

How do you know if this solution works?

Verify your connection performance: Allows you to confirm if you are getting the speed contracted with your Internet provider.
Diagnose connection problems: If the results are low, it may be an indication of problems with your provider or with your network configuration.
Optimize your online experience: By knowing your connection speed, you can adjust video quality, avoid downloading large files during peak hours, or even consider switching providers if necessary.
Help you make decisions: If you are considering switching internet plans, the speed test helps you choose the most suitable plan for your needs.

Why might this solution work?
Diagnosing the state of connectivity in remote contexts is fundamental to know what type of connectivity solution is most suitable for each context.
For example, it is important to know how to do this when we go to the field in SOLE Colombia projects. We have found that having a complete Internet experience, learning to characterize the community and the Internet connection it has, as well as the fluctuations and inconveniences of the place where the solution is going to be installed, make people engage in the experience of self-organized learning in a very powerful and intense way. Feeling able to be able to set up or enhance the internet signal to be able to use it as a group, makes everything more powerful… you can see the stories here: www.solecolombia.org/blog

A governance solution for common resources
Solution Video
You can watch this video while developing this solution.
[
  
  
](
  
  
)
Welcome
Hello, my name is Mateo and I will accompany you in this solution. If you are here is because you are interested in knowing how to take care and use those technological equipments that belong to your community or work team. In this case, when we talk about technological equipment we are referring to a computer, an antenna, a tablet, a data plan, etc. and to a material good that does not belong to anyone in particular, but to a community or group of people.
💡 Inspiration! In SOLE Colombia we want more people to use the internet and technological equipment in groups, because it brings many benefits: - Using it together is more fun and invites us to share ideas - It is more economical and invites us to work as a team - When there is another person next to you is less likely to fall into malicious pages or cyber scams.
What is using the game to learn to take care of teams in community?
People develop teamwork skills, learn to value collective responsibility and understand the importance of cooperating for the common good in a supportive environment. An excellent strategy to do this is through games and participatory activities.
What is this solution for?
To begin with, you will be surprised if I tell you that we do not want to give you magic formulas on how to care for and use technological equipment in community, since we do not know the particularities of where you live and we understand that each context is different, but we do have a fun and deep game that will allow you to reach agreements with your community or work team called the Fish Game. With this game we hope that your community will reflect on the care, distribution and management of common resources on planet earth, while discussing how to reach agreements for the shared use of the equipment at your disposal.
What do you need?

You must have a bag of at least 80 candies, beans or tokens of the same size with which you will represent the fish in the game.
A table.
Chairs surrounding the table.
Cardboard sheet size.
Markers.

How to do it?


Moment 1: first game


💡 For the first game place 50 of the 80 fish in the center of a table and tell the participants: “There are 50 fish in a lake and you are fishermen/fisherwomen. To fish you must follow the following instructions:
*a. Each one can catch between 0 and 5 fish per round.*

*b. You may not talk; you may only use your body language.*

*c. Fish reproduce: 1 new fish is born for every 10 fish left available on the table after the round is over. Example: if there are 30 fish left on the tables, you must place three new fish.*

*d. You decide when you finish the game."*


After giving the instructions leave the bag with the 30 extra fish on the table and check that each person has his or her time to decide how many fish to take.

At the end of the round ask the players to return the fish and ask the group:

- How did they feel about the distribution of the fish, did they feel it was fair?






Moment 2: second game


💡 For the second game the conditions change, so explain the following instructions out loud: “Now there are 50 fish in a lake and you are still fishermen, the difference is that you are in a drought season, so fishing is much more difficult. There is a lot of scarcity and you must guarantee food to feed your families in the coming weeks.”
**The rules of the game are the same. Mention the rules again to the participants if necessary.
At the end of the round ask them: 

- What has changed now? How do they feel about the distribution?
- Do you think there might be similar difficulties when sharing the technological equipment in your community?



Moment 3: third game


💡 For the third game, the situation is the same as the second game, but the instructions change: “There are 50 fish in a lake and you are still fishermen, the difference is that it is the time of drought, so fishing is much more difficult. There is a lot of scarcity and you must guarantee food to feed your families for the next few weeks. There is not much time and so they must make quick decisions. ” a. They can each catch between 0 and 5 fish per round. b. They can talk 2 minutes before fishing to decide how best to do it. c. Fish spawn: 1 new fish is born for every 10 fish that are available after the round is over. Example: if there are 30 fish left on the tables, you must put in three new fish. d. You decide when the game ends.”
At the end of the round, ask the participants: 

- Did the agreement you reached at the beginning of the game change anything?
- Which of the games do you think had the fairest distribution? What differences are there among the three games?
- How could the agreement they have made for the use and care of the technological equipment they have at their disposal be carried out?



Moment 4: the secret of reaching agreements


💡 Tell people the secrets of the game to reach agreements:
- The fishermen represent each of the people in your community.
- The fish represent the finite resources or technological equipment that are available to the community, e.g., computers, internet antennas, data plans, etc. These fish also apply as an analogy about managing finite resources such as land, water, food or the air we breathe.
    
    The key to this game is that the more fish we catch for ourselves, the less fish will reproduce; so we all lose.
    
    Likewise, the less fish we catch, the more fish will reproduce on the table and the more resources the community will have. 
    
    <img src="/assets\images\¿Cómo usar el juego para aprender a cuidar equipos 12a2bd68c5b6801a8d61de57be65d679\WhatsApp_Image_2024-04-11_at_10.09.11_PM-800w.webp" alt="WhatsApp Image 2024-04-11 at 10.09.11 PM.jpeg" srcset="/assets\images\¿Cómo usar el juego para aprender a cuidar equipos 12a2bd68c5b6801a8d61de57be65d679\WhatsApp_Image_2024-04-11_at_10.09.11_PM-400w.webp 400w, /assets\images\¿Cómo usar el juego para aprender a cuidar equipos 12a2bd68c5b6801a8d61de57be65d679\WhatsApp_Image_2024-04-11_at_10.09.11_PM-800w.webp 800w, /assets\images\¿Cómo usar el juego para aprender a cuidar equipos 12a2bd68c5b6801a8d61de57be65d679\WhatsApp_Image_2024-04-11_at_10.09.11_PM-1200w.webp 1200w" sizes="(max-width: 600px) 400px, (max-width: 1200px) 800px, 1200px" loading="lazy" />

Moment 5: let’s reach an agreement
Give participants the poster board and markers. Invite them to write agreements on how to manage the resources or technological equipment they have at their disposal. We recommend downloading the following template to guide you in the conversation.
[Reglas uso y cuidado compartido de equipo tecnológicos.pptx](../../../../../Soluciona 1292bd68c5b681c6b5b5cec1700cc864/Solutions DB 1292bd68c5b681d1b87ccbb89a1b1d39/¿Cómo usar el juego para aprender a cuidar equipos 12a2bd68c5b6801a8d61de57be65d679/Reglas_uso_y_cuidado_compartido_de_equipo_tecnolgicos.pptx)
These questions are only a guide, so you can add or remove questions as you see fit. Ask participants to write down the agreements they reached and invite them to share them with the rest of the community. This is essential because, in times of conflict or difficulties in solving a problem, they can go back to what they have written to come up with solutions or to rethink new agreements.


How does the game work?
First game: in the first game people usually consume fish based on their interests and other people’s behaviors. If one person consumes a lot of fish (5), other people tend to be motivated to consume the same amount; the same applies the other way around, if one person consumes few fish, other people (with some exceptions) tend to be motivated to consume less. Now, there are no magic formulas nor is the future written about what may happen, the key is to observe people’s behaviors, as this will allow you to make powerful reflections on the responsible and communal management of finite resources.
Second game: due to the conditioning of drought and the urgency to feed the family, in the second game people tend to consume more than in the first and third games, which causes the distribution of fish to be more inequitable and to run out faster. In other words, more tension is generated between personal benefit and common benefit. In behavioral psychology, this situation is called present bias: human beings, feeling that a resource is about to run out, activate a sense of loss that drives us to consume irrationally even when we do not need it.
Third game: at this point, participants usually reach agreements by consuming less fish so that they reproduce more, preventing situations of scarcity and finding community alternatives for the equitable and fair management of resources; however, there is a possibility that this may not happen, the important thing is that you tell them the value of reaching agreements in the management of finite resources or technological equipment. When we reach agreements, all of us can benefit; on the contrary, when we all seek our personal benefits, the resources from which we can benefit tend to be destroyed, as well as our opportunity to continue to benefit from them.
How much is enough? The tragedy of the commons
The tragedy of the commons is a problem about social relations and human behavior described by Garret Hardin in 1968 for Science magazine, in which he poses a thought experiment imagining a farmer who decides, on land shared with other farmers, to start putting more cows, since it generates more profit and personal benefits for him. The other farmers decide to do the same, so the field fills up with cows, the land is overexploited and deteriorates rapidly. Likewise, the farmers are left with many cows and no land to produce. This dilemma shows how we can destroy finite shared resources if each of us seeks only personal profit and invites us to think about the importance of reaching agreements about shared resources.
Compromise does work!
We would like to share with you the story of Alexander, a community leader from the village of Agrado, located in the Department of Cauca. Alexander, together with his community, managed to reach an agreement on how to use the internet through an agreement they made with the store that is located next to the communal hut. Let’s listen to his story:

es/inspire/how-to-write-a-good-invitatio.title: How to write a good invitation
es/inspire/how-to-write-a-good-invitatio.content:
How to write a good invitation
Created: 30 de agosto de 2025 23:19
Autor: Manuela
Solucionas: People
Dificultad: Fácil
Cuesta: >$ 100 COP
Ayudantes: 2-3 personas
Tardas: Horas
R-reactions: No
Descarga esta solución para usarla desconectado
Como_escribir_una_buena_invitacion_20250729.pdf
Download this solution to use it disconnected
How_to_write_a_good_invitation_20250729.pdf
index
Create your own invitation
Welcome
Hello 🙂 I’m Manu, the storyteller of SOLE Colombia.
In my day to day life I have had to make many invitations, that’s why I’m the right person to help you create an invitation.
What does it mean to write a good invitation?
A good invitation is one that correctly informs the guest, generates interest, facilitates the confirmation of attendance and has a design according to the nature of the event.
Making an invitation is challenging. Facing a blank sheet of paper and not knowing where to start is something that even best-selling writers suffer from.
So don’t worry, you’re not alone.
With a few tips and a little creativity, we can make your SOLE, your meetings, projects or initiatives convey a clear message so that your guests will say yes to your invitation.
What is it for?
Follow these recommendations or tips when you need to make an invitation. If you are lost and don’t know where to start, I recommend you to go first to Create a powerful message. This way you will have more tools to make your invitation.
Are you ready to learn how to conquer with words and make your next invitation a success? Let’s make a powerful invitation together!


ATTENTION
I can’t guarantee the punctuality of the people, but I can guarantee their confirmation.


What do you need?

Paper.
Pencil/Pencil.
Enthusiasm.
Cell phone or computer (you can also write your invitation there).

How to do it?


Moment 1: The content
It is very important that in all your invitations it is very clear the what, the how and the where of what you plan to do.
Let’s get down to work:

Grab a blank sheet of paper and write down what you are going to do at your meeting. This can range from watching a movie, discussing an important issue in your community or doing SOLE.
Then, answer how you are going to do it, for example: film forum, meeting in the community hall, creating a community work group.
Now, you only need to write the where: in your house, in the community hall of Vereda Arroyito, in the Luis Ángel Arango Library… any space you have planned and that’s it!

It doesn’t matter if you don’t get it right the first time, look at all the times I had to erase in the video to make my invitation… We’ll be fine-tuning step by step!
[20240801_SOLE+BOLT_Voltaje_Escribe_tu_invitación_1.mp4](../../../../../Soluciona 1292bd68c5b681c6b5b5cec1700cc864/Solutions DB 1292bd68c5b681d1b87ccbb89a1b1d39/¿Cómo escribir una buena invitación 12a2bd68c5b68097a274ccb479447151/20240801_SOLEBOLT_Voltaje_Escribe_tu_invitacin_1.mp4)


Momento 2: La escritura
¡Bien! Ha llegado el momento de liberar toda esa creatividad en el papel, con el contenido claro va a ser mucho más sencillo hacer la invitación.


“El gancho”, cómo atraer la atención
En el mundo de las invitaciones la primera frase es fundamental, por eso existen diferentes técnicas para atraer la atención de las personas y que en esos primeros segundos de lectura se sientan comprometidos.




💡 Las preguntas: Iniciar las frases con preguntas directas, suele ser una opción que actualmente se usa mucho en redes sociales para captar la atención inmediata del espectador. Por ejemplo: ¿Te animas a participar de este encuentro? o ¿Te gustaría convocar a tu comunidad?
💡 Los datos: “Después de más de 60.000 mil muertos en Palestina, nos preguntamos para qué sirve la ONU”. Así inicia el artículo de un medio de comunicación alternativo sobre el conflicto en Palestina. ¿Qué tal si inicias tu invitación con datos relevantes del tema principal de tu encuentro?
💡 Las frases potentes: También puedes simplemente escoger una frase potente, concisa y clara, que de cuenta en un solo vistazo de qué se trata tu invitación. Aunque parece un poco obvio, podrías usar  la frase: “Te invito a  actividad que vas a hacer)”  para convocar a tus participantes.
    Yo me fui por esta última opción. Mira lo que escribí:
    
    [20240801_SOLE+BOLT_Escribe_tu_invitación_2.mp4](../../../../../Soluciona 1292bd68c5b681c6b5b5cec1700cc864/Solutions DB 1292bd68c5b681d1b87ccbb89a1b1d39/¿Cómo escribir una buena invitación 12a2bd68c5b68097a274ccb479447151/20240801_SOLEBOLT_Escribe_tu_invitacin_2.mp4)
    
- **‘La pulidora’, cómo afinar el mensaje**
    
    Aquí vamos directo al grano. 
    
    Ponte manos a la obra: 
    
    1. Subraya la respuesta a las preguntas  *cómo* y *dónde* (las que escribimos en la sección ‘El contenido’, un poco más arriba en esta Solución). 
    2. Ahora, escribe los datos claros del **día**, la **hora**, la **fecha**, y el **lugar** en dónde vas a convocar a tu gente (sin nada de adorno). 
    
    [20240801_SOLE+BOLT_Escribe_tu_invitación_3.mp4](../../../../../Soluciona 1292bd68c5b681c6b5b5cec1700cc864/Solutions DB 1292bd68c5b681d1b87ccbb89a1b1d39/¿Cómo escribir una buena invitación 12a2bd68c5b68097a274ccb479447151/20240801_SOLEBOLT_Escribe_tu_invitacin_3.mp4)
    
    Pon lo que escribiste en tu *cómo*, de la forma más resumida y clara posible. Ejemplo: Si tu *cómo* era una reunión en el salón comunal, pon: “Salón comunal de [Nombre de tu comunidad]”.
    
- **‘La acción’, qué le pides a tu audiencia que haga en este momento**
    
    ¡Te felicito! Con este paso vamos a terminar de escribir la invitación.. ¡Ánimo! ¡Ánimo! ¡Queda poco!
    
    Casi siempre, cuando leemos algo, solemos quedarnos con la última frase. Incluso, muchas veces, sólo recordamos el final de un libro, de una historia, o de una noticia. Por eso, **la forma en la que termina tu invitación es TAN IMPORTANTE**, porque así es como vamos a llevar a la acción a nuestros invitados. 
    
    Actividad: Usa un verbo en acción para iniciar la frase que cierra tu invitación.
    
    [20240801_SOLE+BOLT_Escribe_tu_invitación_4.mp4](../../../../../Soluciona 1292bd68c5b681c6b5b5cec1700cc864/Solutions DB 1292bd68c5b681d1b87ccbb89a1b1d39/¿Cómo escribir una buena invitación 12a2bd68c5b68097a274ccb479447151/20240801_SOLEBOLT_Escribe_tu_invitacin_4.mp4)
    

  

Don’t underestimate the power of a good invitation.
When you need to make an invitation, don’t forget that the most important thing is to trust your own abilities; you know your people better than anyone else. You’ll be amazed at the power of a few well-chosen words to inspire and rally the community!
Now it’s your turn to conquer your community with your own words, visit ¡Aprende a diseñar tu invitación exprés sin ser un experto! for more tips on your invitation.
Good luck 😉

es/inspire/identificador-ssid-ssid-ident.title: Identificador SSID | SSID Identifier
es/inspire/identificador-ssid-ssid-ident.content:
Identificador SSID | SSID Identifier
Fecha de creación: 30 de agosto de 2025 23:19
Autor(a): Belen Sevilla Morillo
R2025: revisado
idioma: english, español
Español
El SSID, o Identificador de Conjunto de Servicios, es el nombre que identifica a una red Wi-Fi. 
Es el nombre que ves cuando buscas redes inalámbricas disponibles en tu dispositivo, como un teléfono o computadora. Permite a los usuarios distinguir entre diferentes redes Wi-Fi en un área determinada y conectarse a la red deseada. (Fuente: [Lenovo](www.lenovo.com/mx/es/glosario/ssid/#:~:text=Ofertas-,¿Qué es un identificador de conjunto de servicio (SSID)?,casa%2C%20puedes%20elegir%20su%20SSID.))
En términos más sencillos, el SSID es como el nombre de una red Wi-Fi, como “Casa de Juan” o “Starbucks_Wi-Fi”. Los dispositivos utilizan el SSID para encontrar y conectarse a la red correcta. Es importante recordar que el SSID no proporciona seguridad por sí mismo; la seguridad de la red se logra mediante protocolos como WPA2 o WPA3. (Fuente: www.kaspersky.com/resource-center/definitions/what-is-an-ssid)
En resumen, el SSID es el nombre que identifica una red Wi-Fi y facilita a los usuarios la conexión a la red deseada. (Fuente: www.fortinet.com/lat/resources/cyberglossary/service-set-identifier-ssid)
English
The SSID, or Service Set Identifier, is the name that identifies a Wi-Fi network.
It is the name you see when you scan for available wireless networks on your device, such as a phone or computer. It allows users to distinguish between different Wi-Fi networks in a given area and connect to the desired network (Source: [Lenovo](www.lenovo.com/mx/es/glosario/ssid/#:~:text=Ofertas-,¿Qué es un identificador de conjunto de servicio (SSID)?,casa%2C%20puedes%20elegir%20su%20SSID.)).
In simpler terms, the SSID is like the name of a Wi-Fi network, such as “Casa de Juan” or “Starbucks_Wi-Fi.” Devices use the SSID to find and connect to the correct network. It is important to remember that the SSID does not provide security by itself; network security is achieved by protocols such as WPA2 or WPA3. (Source: www.kaspersky.com/resource-center/definitions/what-is-an-ssid
In short, the SSID is the name that identifies a Wi-Fi network and makes it easy for users to connect to the desired network. (Source: www.fortinet.com/lat/resources/cyberglossary/service-set-identifier-ssid

Inspiración Cacharrera
Tags: Aprendizajes
Formato: Texto
idioma: español
pie: No
